item.title: Japan | Government will study Trump's tariffs on steel
item.description: The Japanese government said yesterday that it will study the plans of the president of the United States regarding the imposition of tariffs in the order of 25 percent on steel and aluminum imports. "We are aware of what President Trump said about steel and aluminum, from Japan, we will carefully study the content of the measure he takes and his influence and later we will take the right measures," said the spokesman From the Japanese government, Yoshimasa Hayashi, at a press conference. Hayashi made these comments when asked about President Trump's announcement to impose reciprocal tariffs on other business partners and a 25 percent rate on steel and aluminum imports. "I don't know if the announcement includes Japan, but the agreement between Nippon Steel and U.S. Steel is a great way to resolve the issue and, although not knowing how it will be realized, I think this is how they intend to overcome the problem," he said Masakazu Tokura, president of the largest Japanese employer organization, Keidanren, to NHK public station. Tokura referred to the latest developments in the process of acquiring U.S. Steel by the Japanese Nippon Steel.

item.description: A man was circumvented in 8,900 yuan while trying to buy, over the internet, tickets for a concert in the interior. item.title: Game | Citigroup makes review at low growth
item.description:
With many of the largest gamblers to be owners of companies that export to the United States, the investment bank believes Donald Trump's fares will have an indirect impact on Macau
The Citigroup Investment Bank has reduced the game sector's growth forecasts for more than half for more than half. The decrease was explained by what was considered the poor performance of casinos during the Lunar New Year, traditionally one of the highest times of tourism, as well as the impact of Donald Trump's tariffs on Chinese exports to the United States. According to the Investment Bank, quoted by the GGR Asia Portal, most VIP players in Macao casinos are home to factories, often with export -facing businesses, including the United States. Therefore, the bank considers that there is a risk that these players see their income affected, with 10 percent rates on imports in the United States for Chinese products, which will have consequences in the amount available to play, as well as willingness to come to Macau. According to the new forecast, Citigroup estimates that the game's gross gross revenues record a growth of 3 percent, which contrasts with the previous forecast, which indicated a growth of 7 percent. And in the first half of the year, the investment bank admits that gross revenues even record a reduction of about 1 percent. Below the expected From the perspective of Citigroup, the game industry generated averages of 589 million patacas a day in January and “about 900 million patacas” per day in the early days of February, which represents a below expected value. The first four days of February have already covered the period of celebrations of the year Lunar. The bank has attributed the revenue levels disappointing to “some last -minute cancellations to Macau by the players”, which took place in the last days of the festivities. "These two data make us more cautious about the short-term trends of the game's recipes," wrote analysts George Choi and Timothy Chau, in the report quoted by the GGR Asia portal. "We believe that the implementation of US tariffs against China on February 1 has reduced the search for the game at the end of the new year and anticipated that this impact will continue for most of the first half of 2025," he was justified. “According to the current trend, if we join the revenues of January and February, we can see a negative trend,” he was added. Distinct stories Despite the pessimism for the first half of the year, the situation should improve in the second phase, with Citi indicating that it expects a “milder picture in June”. "We hope that the feeling of players will start to recover in the second half of 2025, as the impact of [American] tariffs is being digested," he was pointed out. As one of the factors of optimism for the second half of the year, Citi points out that the search for game tables should “accelerate as big events return to Macau”, indicating as an example the show of actor and singer Jacky Cheung, scheduled For June at the Galaxy Arena.

item.title: Markets | Leong Sun Iok asks for development plans
item.description:
With homeless to face difficulties in the São Domingos market, the workers' deputy asks AMI to authorize the sale of more differentiated products and to create a cultural zone on the building's underground floor, to the cultural industries
Leong Sun Iok has asked the institute for municipal affairs to reveal the development plans of local markets, especially with regard to newsstands on the streets. The request is part of a written interpellation of the deputy linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom), released yesterday. According to the deputy, in recent years AMI has renewed several local markets and updated the laws, which has allowed the restoration level to offer in these spaces to be in greater consonant with recent trends. However, Leong Sun IOK argues that AMI should present projects to the situation of newsstands abroad, which are disappearing, even in some of the most popular markets, as in the São Domingos market or the mud market. “The São Domingos and Taipa markets are located in very busy areas of the city, very frequented by residents and tourists. But although I would have optimized markets in recent years, with the redefinition of interior zones, improvement of the homes and available a better consumer experience, the big problem is related to new consumption habits at the stalls level ”Wrote the deputy. "There are fewer and fewer people buying on the street newsstands of the markets, which makes traders disappear," he added. Therefore, the deputy wants to know how AMI will allow sales newsstands to adapt to the new times: “In 2023, AMI said it was considering optimizing street newsstands on the São Domingos market, based on in consumer habits of residents and tourists. What is the situation of these works? ”He asks. Bet on consumption In the same vein, the deputy intends to know if AMI will conduct a study of the products with greater demand in the foreign newsstands of the market, then trying to launch new galls of the newsstands to sell them. On the other hand, Leong Sun Iok suggests that the São Domingos market can also be used as a cultural place: “In terms of the São Domingos market, the underground floor is currently being used as a collection. Will AMI consider free this space and use it for other purposes, namely for cultural activities and for the development of this type of industries? ”He asked. At the interpetement, the deputy also intends to make a point of situation about the progress of the work of renewal of the mud market, namely about the possibility of holding a contest for innovative entrepreneurs, with a view to distributing the sales newsstands.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence | Study highlights China's leadership goal
item.description:
China aims to lead the global market of artificial intelligence, “both in terms of theory and application”, seeking self-sufficiency in this domain. This is one of the conclusions of Muhammed Can's PhD Thesis, “Artificial Intelligence as a resource: an evaluation of China's mobilization and extraction strategies”, defended at the University of Minho
A few months before the launch of the “DeepSeek” platform in China, which revolutionized the Artificial Intelligence (AI) market in competition with the chatgPT, was defended at the University of Minho (one) a doctoral thesis that precisely concludes, the ones Steps Beijing is taking to look for global leadership in this area. The work, by Muhammed Can, calls “Artificial Intelligence as Resource: An Appraisal of China's Mobilization and Extraction Strategies” [Artificial Intelligence as a resource: an evaluation of China's mobilization and extraction strategies], and analyzes the connection of the He went to international relations, as well as the strategy that the country has adopted in this domain in recent years. The thesis, in the area of ​​political science and international relations, was defended at the school of Economics and Management of UM. Thus, it is concluded that the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) “aims to become the world leader in both theory and AI-applications”, and some main objectives were outlined for “the process of resource mobilization and development AI ”. According to the author, they go through the “search for self-sufficiency, a view of 2015 strategy, 'Made in China 2025 ′”, as well as “economic transformation, with a view to perfectly integrating AI and automation in the national economy perfectly ”. Moreover, the author considers that Beijing seeks to become a competitor and leader in the AI ​​area to combat advances in other markets, namely in the United States, using initiatives such as the “Digital Silk Route of China and definition efforts of patterns as the way for external validation ”. Thus, "China's external resource extraction strategies are facilitated by the various economic mechanisms, aiming at the transfer of knowledge and talent acquisition, with the aim of filling out the resource gap with the United States." The “techno-nationalism” The thesis also speaks of the notion of “techno-nationalism”, linked to the area of ​​international relations, such as “the most important variable in China's AI policy”, and can also “be seen as a continuation and manifestation of the strategy of ' Two markets, two features' of the CCP ”. With this approach, China intends to "protect the domestic market and, simultaneously, expand abroad, promote the sale of products manufactured in China and extract resources such as data, talent, know-how and many others." In addition, “the implications of techno-nationalism also extend to foreign technological companies that operate in China”, since, “in the context of ordinary companies, China uses several barriers and takes advantage of its national legal framework as an instrument for an instrument for the strategic transfer of technology and specialized knowledge ”. Academic work takes into account the policies and laws implemented between 2012 and 2023, concluding that after the launch of the “New Generation Artificial Intelligence Development Plan” [NAIDP, in the English acronym], in 2017, the Chinese strategy for AI Won a new direction. "The thesis shows that the pace to which the resources were mobilized increased sharply after the announcement of NAIDP in 2017", having been revealed a set of "initiatives and plans related to AI, intended for systematic mobilization of essential resources for the development of I was ”. In the years referring to the study, “the CCP has enacted a series of data related policies and laws, including laws related to the privacy of individual data”, introducing “legal frameworks specifically related to national security, which have direct implications for governance and data regulation ”. The author also describes the way Beijing has adopted to mobilize all resources available around AI policy, with the Council of State “promulgating comprehensive strategic plans pertinent to AI or AI -related matters - such as the action plan Triennial Internet + Artificial Intelligence ”. It is these documents that will “articulate short and long term goals and standards, serving as a course for a coordinated development in this field”. Essential resources in developing AI projects and policies are “data, algorithms and computing capacity”. It should be noted that there is a “CCP resource mobilization strategy” that has the “approach of 'whole society' and 'whole government'”. Such "implies that all segments of society, including government institutions, private companies and individuals, may be involved in AI development effort if it is considered necessary." It is, according to the thesis, "an integrated approach that allows a more cohesive and comprehensive strategy for the mobilization of resources in the context of AI development." After “the introduction of global strategies”, the CCP “begins the process of mobilization of resources through designated government institutions”, namely ministries, the AI ​​promotion office and the China Cyberspace administration ”. “To improve its resource mobilization strategy, the CCP actively incorporates private actors in the AI ​​development ecosystem. By designating certain large technological companies such as AI national champions, the government not only mobilizes these companies, but also encourages them to mobilize more resources according to the state's strategic objectives ”, it reads. Importance of local governments Like in other fields, China realized early on that AI was an important area to invest and would have to be part of economic and political strategies. Thus, Muhammed Can's thesis "demonstrates that CCP changes in technological policy are closely aligned with the strategic environment," as the party "has realized opportunities and threats in significant global developments." Still regarding the mobilization of resources for the development of AI, the author speaks of a process “complex and distributed instead of a singular approach, from top to bottom, led only by the CCP or the State Council”. “Although the CCP establishes the general rules and guidelines, it actively involves a wide range of stakeholders - including companies, universities and ministerial bodies - in the mobilization process. This distributed strategy can be understood in the context of China's size, both in terms of population and geographical extension, which requires a more dispersed approach. ” The author highlights the “preponderant role that local governments play in the development of AI” because “they function as extensions of the central authority, and their active involvement implies direct mobilization of resources”, namely at the level of algorithms and computing capacity. "The thesis concludes that local governments have also instituted various strategies to improve policies associated with data, algorithms and computing capacity," can be read. “Some local governments took the initiative to formulate their own AI strategies before the central authorities issued official guidelines. Subsequently, these local strategies were reviewed to conform to the central directives. ” To analyze local AI policies, the author analyzed the cases of Shanghai and Shenzhen. Moreover, the idea of ​​mobilization around the AI ​​area is attached with historical issues, as Beijing has always sought the avant-garde in the technology area, namely since the Cold War times. As read in the thesis, “China began to rely heavily on exported technology from the Soviet Union after the creation of the Popular Republic of China”, but “the restrictive strategic environment began to evolve with the historic visit of US President Richard Nixon , in 1972 ”, having represented" an invaluable opportunity for China and the US counterbalances the Soviet threat. " Thanks to archive research, the author concludes that "China's strategic environment has moved to a partially permissive state around 1978, coinciding with the beginning of the reform and opening policies of leader Deng Xiaoping." From this year onwards, “a dramatic expansion of opportunities for the CCP in the field of technological development”. In general terms, "the concept of mobilization is intrinsically linked to the longtime vanguard role of the CCP, a role that facilitated the rapid mobilization of resources during key moments of its history." Not on purpose, China has participated since yesterday at the Summit about AI that takes place in Paris, the AI ​​action summit, having sent Deputy Prime Minister Zhang Quoqing. In this summit, which ends today, “heads of state, researchers and technology companies that will discuss how governments should respond to rapid advances in this domain are present,” according to Lusa.

item.title: Cinema | ‘Nezha 2’ becomes the most viewed movie in China's history
item.description: The ‘Nezha 2’ animation became the most viewed movie in China's history, days after hitting the revenue record, reaching 5.8 billion Yuan. On Sunday, ‘Nezha 2’ exceeded the film of Wolf Warrior (2015), also Chinese, reaching 159 million tickets sold, according to data from the Specialized Portal Maoyan. Both ‘Nezha 2’ and the prequel, ‘Nezha’ (2019), are based on a 16th -century Chinese classic novel called "Investiture of the Gods." The film, which premiered during Lunar New Year's holidays, captivated viewers for the narrative, cultural impact and visual quality, according to Chinese official news agency Xinhua. Maoyan predicts that production can become the first movie to raise more than 10 billion Yuan in the Chinese market. The success of ‘Nezha 2’ is a breath of fresh air for an industry in trouble: in 2024, the Chinese box office raised 42.502 billion yuan, less 22.5 percent than in 2023. Chinese productions dominated the domestic market in 2024, generating 78.7 percent of total revenues. Chinese authorities limit the number of foreign films, with a quota system that allows the display of about 35 productions per year. The drop in revenues in 2024 was a setback for a sector that had already been affected during the rigorous Zero Covid politics, which led to the closing of thousands of movie theaters and the functioning of others with boundaries in the number of spectators.

item.title: HK | Electronic cigarettes will be prohibited in public places
item.description: Hong Kong will prohibit the possession and use of electronic cigarettes in public spaces by mid -2026 due to the health implications of young residents, authorities of the Chinese Semiautonoma region said. "To protect our young people, we believe it is time to ban the use of electronic cigarettes cartridges," the secretary for health, Lo Chung-Mau, said on Sunday. "We will start by legislating against possession and use [of electronic cigarettes] outdoors," he added. "When everyone gets used to [the prohibition], we will implement it everywhere," he added. The announcement was made almost three years after the territory of southern China prohibited the importation, manufacture and sale of electronic cigarettes and heated tobacco products. According to the Hong Kong law, anyone who imports electronic cigarettes can face up to seven years in prison and a two million dollars of Hong Kong. Manufacturers and sellers risk catching up to six months in prison. Also the neighboring region of Macao banned, in 2022, the manufacture, distribution, importation, export and transportation at the entrance and exit of the territory of electronic cigarettes. item.description: The life and work of guitar master Carlos Paredes, who “created a genuinely Portuguese song out of nowhere”, is told in a book to be presented this week in Portugal and which includes the recordings of two concerts, one of which is unprecedented. In “Carlos Paredes - the guitar of a people”, the researcher Octávio Fonseca begins to tell the guitarist's route before he was born, reminiscent of his family background. Carlos Paredes, who would complete a hundred years of life on February 16, descend from a family of guitarists and composers: great-grandfather António Rodrigues Paredes, grandfather Gonçalo Rodrigues Paredes, grand-uncle Manuel Rodrigues Paredes and father, Artur Paredes. According to Octávio Fonseca, Artur Paredes, “in terms of technique, completely revolutionized the guitar of Coimbra”, and Carlos Paredes “took advantage of this work and simplified it”. To tell the story and stories of Carlos Paredes, Octávio Fonseca resorted to the research work he had done to another book dedicated to the guitarist edited in 2000, which included reading articles on music that 'master' wrote in newspapers and interviews that gave to various media. But to write this book, she featured “the extraordinary collaboration” of guitarist and songwriter Luísa Amaro, companion of walls. "Most of the stories that are told in the book were she who conveyed to me," he said. What makes Carlos Paredes a unique artist is, for Octavio Fonseca, the fact that he created “genuinely Portuguese music of nowhere”. “In the late 1960s, early 1970s, we were very discussing to go to traditional roots, to create a Portuguese popular music, as José Afonso did. But Carlos Paredes did not do that, and created a Portuguese song out of nowhere. He did not start from our traditional song, nor from any experience of Portuguese music, ”said the researcher. The parallelism between José Afonso and Carlos Paredes was pointed out by the guitarist himself. “He says in two interviews that there is a parallel between him and José Afonso at the beginning of his career. Carlos Paredes's first album is from 1962 and José Afonso's first ballad album as well (he had albums before, but it was from Fado de Coimbra). They both make a new song from Coimbra, ”he said. The following year, the two musicians “break free from Coimbra, from the song of Coimbra”, but with a difference, “while with José Afonso there is a complete cut, with Carlos Paredes there is a cut, but there are always a 'penguinhos' in the compositions in which Coimbra appears ”. MUSICAL NEWS “Carlos Paredes - the guitar of a people” is accompanied by two records. One is “Master of the Portuguese Guitar”, an album recorded in 1977, at the 7th Political Song Festival in Berlin, published this year by her friend, editor of the former German Democratic Republic (RDA), which is unprecedented in Portugal. In the other album is recorded “The First Show Carlos Paredes made in his own name in Portugal”, an unprecedented recording registered on March 31, 1984, at the Carlos Alberto Theater, in Porto. The book also includes a photo portfolio by Carlos Paredes, by Augusto Cabrita, Luís Paulo Moura and Inácio Ludgero. The musician lived mainly in Lisbon and the city inspired many of his compositions. “Green Years”, one of the best known of his work, was composed for the homonymous film of Paulo Rocha, milestone of the new Portuguese cinema of the 1960s. Anti-fascist combatant, opposed the dictatorship and was arrested by PIDE in the late 1950s. Until the 1990s, it reconciled the guitar with its administrative activity at the São José Hospital in Lisbon. In December 1993, he was diagnosed with myelopathy, a disease that attacked him the bone structure and that prevented him from playing guitar.

item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, coordinator of the Educational Service of CCCM 2025 January 29, 2025 To know more deeply the nature of wooden serpent yin (乙巳蛇 yǐ sì shé), it will be convenient to analyze the stories related to this reptile of the sixth terrestrial field in close association with the female principle. It comes closely associated with the matriarchal divinity nϋwa (女娲 nǚwā) in the following myths “nϋwa creates humans” (女娲造人 nǚwā zào fench) and “nϋwa to the sky” (女娲补天 nǚwā bǔ tiān). In myths divinity arises alone, complete in itself, as a creative force, in the first myth, and as a regenerating and constructive force in the second, when mending the sky. As a mother of humanity, he did not remember being the following one of a visit to Earth, having first created the animals, but as he still felt deep loneliness, he decided to generate human beings: he could do so for containing powerful energy Soul, manifested in his quality of being heavenly, whose physical appearance was distinguished, because although he had a human head, he had a serpent body. It spontaneously generated with the help of the clay, that is, the Earth, an element to which it is indissolibly linked, either in the underground world, in wells, or in its agile climbing by the mountains and trees in an instinctive search for heavenly ascension. It is still this same figure with a serpent body that will replace order on Earth, when it plunges into chaos, following dignifying titanic forces, as in some versions it is affirmed that he has not wounded the sky after the god of northern Água do Norte, gonggong Founded his head against Buzhoushan (共工怒触不周山 Gònggōng Nù Chù Bùzhōushān), in an attack of fury against Northern Heavenly Emperor, Zhuanxu (颛顼 Zhuānxū), following the defeat inflicted by this. The way it has not taken the sky, the care it has put in raising its pillars, establishing them with the aid of stones, whose colors (green, yellow, white, dark and red) indicate the presence of the five elements, essential to Life, as well as the foundation of them erected on the paws of a black turtle, in order to ensure their longevity but even eternity; The precious aid he granted to humanity in the fight against beasts that in the bastard of collapse pulled, the works of drainage he then made, transformed this deity with the body of serpent into one of the foundations of Chinese religious culture and civilization. Note is the powerful ambivalence of this reptile, since it was not booming the body of serpent, Gonggong, the Folunum God of Water, is described with the same body of serpent, otherwise see how portrayed in “Gonggong throws the head against Buzhoushan: “Gonggong was a descendant of Yandi. It had a body of serpent, face and human limbs, as well as red hair, which indicated its fiery, energetic and adamant character ”(WANG, ALVES, 2009: 54). Serpents have poison, which heals as much as it kills, and can become, by their immense mutation capacity, into excellent humans as in the case of Banga Serpent (白娘子 Bai Niángzi), even in small dragons (小龙 xiǎolóng), when developing The generous and meditative facet, when connecting and advocating superior values, such as love, in the famous legend that came to us, for example, through Zhao Qingge (赵清阁) in 《白蛇传》 (Bai shé zhuàn). However, by their strength, capacity and intelligence can conflict as in the history of popular literature “discussion between serpent and the sun”, which might be able to find cultural equivalent in the Aesop's fable competition “wind and the sun”. In “The Serpent argues with the sun” (蛇与太阳的争吵) There is an obvious rivalry between the sun, representative of the yang male element, beautiful, bright, hot and powerful and the equally portentous serpent, considers themselves as much power from the earth. It challenges the sun, beginning a conflict between the power of the lunar mysterious and hidden forces, represented by the serpent, and the splendid irradiative brightness of solar energy. Finally the fable ends not with the victory of the sun, in the manner of Aesop, but with the need for recognition of complementarity, because without the alternation of night and day, sun and shadow, heat and cold the world, As the Chinese understand it (based on this tension harmony) would not be complete. Moral of History: If there was no sun, it would be the death of the earth, for it would plunge into an infinite night, if there were no snakes, it would be equally the end of the world, because there would be no agility, no ability to transform, plunging “everything that exists under heaven ”(天下 tiānxià) in immense rigidity and monotony. The serpent, as a sixth terrestrial field of the Chinese zodiac (十二生肖蛇 shí´èr shēngxiào) also symbolizes the ingenious animal, which, due to its powerful intelligence, is able to architect and carry out a well -calculated plan. This is proved by his biography upon entering the heavenly race promoted by the Emperor of Jade (玉皇大帝 Yù Hung dàdì). The serpent and the dragon used to be good companions and share the same aquatic spaces, when he learned of the emperor's intention to organize a competition so that twelve animals could command the stars and destinations of humans. Given the powerful intelligence of the reptile, he realized that he had no hypothesis or quickness to overcome the dragon, but as he knew how to make good calculations and better plans, he shared discreetly to the horse's back, without the one he was carrying a rival nearby From the goal it jumped to position herself in front of the equity, and so it was, both good friends to our day, since the always generous horse never charged her the ride. For the Chinese, the serpent symbolizes “a powerful and victorious mill” (以巧胜力 yǐ qiǎo shènglì). Another story draws attention to the importance of forgiveness in the ascetic process of the serpent towards transformation into a small dragon: “the serpent and the farmer” (蛇与农夫 shé yǔ knomfū). In a harsh winter, a certain farmer went with a stuffed snake. Studying her, he took him home, putting her in a warm place. When he recovered his strength instead of thanking him for being saved, he attacked the poor unprepared man with the aim of injuring him. This, avoiding in time being bitten and repressing the fury, called the reptile to reason with calmly, asking him if that was how he treated a friend who had saved his life. The serpent, played by the proven goodness of the farmer, never attacked him again. Moral of the story that the Chinese tell their children: goodness pays off and can save not only bodies as souls. The serpent symbolizes the divinity “guardian of the treasures of the earth” in 蛇守护宝藏 (shé shŏuhù bǎozàng), finding himself at the entrance of caves to watch over the infinite riches. The guardians are gigantic, endowed with a prodigious force, but also with deep and mysterious wisdom. Anyone who tries to penetrate these caves will not achieve it as much as they have. item.title: Tourism | Analysis says that Macau is increasingly a leisure destination
item.description:
The academics Pedro Steenhagen and Sofia Xiaoying have analyzed the Macao Tourism Industry, concluding that, increasingly, the territory is viewed as a leisure destination and not as much as a gaming land. The authors warn of the “long way to go regarding the promotion of sustainable tourism”
The Macao Tourism sector has changed in recent years and the visions of the tourists themselves as well, facing the territory as a place where one can walk and enjoy leisure zones, not as much as a game land. This is one of the conclusions of the “Tourism as A Driver of China's Cultural Soft Power: The Role of Macau and the Convergences Between The New Silk Road and the Greater Bay Area” [Tourism as the engine of China's Soft Power: The Role From Macao and the convergences between the new silk route and the Great Bay area], by Pedro Steenhagen, Fudan University, and Sofia Xiaoying Hou, linked to the Xi'an University of International Studies. Analysis of the tourism industry at MSAR is one of the chapters of the book “The Palgrave Handbook on China-Europe-Africa Relations”, recently edited. Thus, it is concluded that “the perception of the image of Macau by tourists has been changing in the last 10 years, being the more and more seen as a place of leisure and vacation in general, and not specifically or purely as a game center. ” It is also added that “the image of masters as a tourist destination is in transition, and people visiting Macao have greatly valued their unique cultural attractions, including their architecture and gastronomy, the result of the mixture of Chinese and Portuguese cultures and inheritances” . However, the authors consider that "Macau still has a long way to go regarding the promotion of effective sustainable tourism." It is understood that sustainable tourism “must fully take into account its economic, social and environmental impacts, addressing the needs of visitors, sector, environment and related communities”. In this field, the authors highlight, quoting another author, that "Macau has made efforts to achieve good grades in these and other subjects, because the rider tourism industry has been undergoing a" silent revolution "since the beginning of the pandemic." It is also noteworthy that, worldwide, the International Tourism Organization has created some guidelines on sustainability, creating “an important framework of sustainable tourism”. For this, “five fundamental pillars were proposed to evaluate the sustainability of the tourism sector of a state”, such as “tourism policy and governance; trade, investment, data and competitiveness; Employment, decent work and training; Reduction of poverty and social inclusion; and sustainability of natural and cultural environments ”. The Silk Route The academics also analyze the role of the Macao tourist sector in the strategy of “a track, a route”, noting that the territory “has been gaining a prominent role in local, regional and external policies, being an actor capable of improving the Tourism Silk Route and streamline tourism in the Great Bay region ”. Macau is understood to make new contributions to the way China presents its culture, because “due to existing heritage and tourist products, it presents the Chinese culture to foreign visitors through a new, more diverse lens that goes beyond traditional” . Thus, tourists are allowed, “especially in the Lusophone world, [create] a better connection and understanding of the country through common historical and cultural bonds”. With regard to the Great Bay project, it is also considered that both this region and the territory of Macao have “actively integrated the tourism development strategies in the BRI frame”, ie “Belt and Road Initiative”, English designation for “a track, a route”. Macao has “a diverse and distinct range of tourist resources, such as the arts, history, constructions and religious traditions, gastronomy, sport, museums, among others”, and local authorities have sought, according to the authors, “Mark its tourist industry, promoting 'Tourism+' with transfronic cooperation in the scope of bri”. The idea is to “create an image of Macau as a city with diverse cultures, integrating the sectors of tourism, entertainment, culture, sports, business, conventions and exhibitions, health care, recreation, technology and big events”. IMPROVEMENTS ON COURSE Pedro Steenhagen and Sofia Xiaoying Hou understand that the Macao government “has been trying to improve cultural soft power and increase tourist attractiveness through product development, facilities and advertising improvement”, and “projects to improve Facilities such as hotels, restaurants, transport and digital tours. ” The example of two digital pathways created by the Cultural Institute, namely, in 2021, “The House of the Family of Zheng Guanying” and also “Fortaleza da Guia”. Moreover, authorities have created several interactive platforms using increased virtual reality. Despite all the efforts pointed out to the local authorities, it is understood that "masters still have an unexplored potential to reinforce cultural ties between China and Portuguese-speaking countries, and this decade may present great opportunities in this regard." The tourist bet In this chapter, the authors also look at the positioning of tourism in the initiative “a track, a route” by Beijing, given that “China has been increasingly paying attention to the need to expand its cultural soft power , both regional and global. ” Thus, the country "has formulated several cultural development plans associated with" a track, a route "and the area of ​​the great bay, and tourism has constantly appeared as an essential element of its global strategy.” In the country "tourism has gained relevance, either as a means of improving international image and as a source of revenue." Only in 2018 “about 159 million visitors traveled to the country, which invested $ 155 billion in tourist infrastructure-a value behind the United States, but should become the first by 2028- since you saw the sector represents 11 percent of your total gross domestic product. ” The authors argue that “by connecting and increasing the dynamics between BRI [Belt and Road Initiative] and the Great Bay area, with an interesting effort on the diversification of Macao's economy and strengthening its tourist sector, as well as among the objectives. National and regional, China seems to be finding a way to boost tourism and reap the fruits in terms of cultural soft power. ” Thus, and in the long run, it is considered that the country “may not only grow the power of its narratives and culture, but also improve normative power and institutional positioning in the world scene, especially with regard to issues of governance ”. It should be noted that the book “The Palgrave Handbook on China-Europe-Africa Relations” is edited by Yichao Li, Jorge Tavares da Silva, Carlos Rodrigues and Francisco José Leandro, from the University of Macau. The edition is in charge of Palgrave Macmillan.

item.title: Portuguese | Study points to Brazil's lack of focus in Macau and China
item.description:
“Brazilian Foreign Policy and the Quest to Promote Portuguese: Building Bridges Through Macau”, a study by João Simões, from the City of Macau, and Daniel Veras, draws attention to the need for Brazil to bet more on the advantages of Macau in the promotion of Portuguese, as well as in China
A study recently published in Janus magazine, from the Autonomous University of Lisbon, draws attention to the fact that Brazil is not properly enjoying the advantages that Macau can offer in the promotion of the Portuguese language, integrated into the country's foreign policy. “Brazilian Foreign Policy and the Quest to Promote Portuguese: Building Bridges Through Macau” [Brazilian foreign policy and the issue of Portuguese promotion: building bridges through Macau] is authored by João Simões, assistant professor at the City of Macau (UCM ) and Daniel Veras, professor at the Pontifical Catholic University of Minas Gerais, in Brazil. “It is time for Brazil to have a more significant presence in Macao, not only through diplomatic channels, but also encouraging the involvement of several non -state actors, such as commerce and investment chambers, professional associations, Brazilian cultural centers, media organs , artistic and cultural foundations, among others ”, read in the article. Thus, the authors consider that this set of partners could help Brazil “leverage the role of Macau as a generator of opportunities, something Brazil has not yet fully enjoyed”, since this “reinforced presence in Macau would allow the consolidation of Existing partnerships between Brazilian universities and mainland China ”. In addition, at the level of students, a more robust presence in Brazil in the MSAR could “bring Chinese students closer to Portuguese from Brazilian companies, reinforcing the connection between education and the business ecosystem of the great bay”, as well as to enhance the production of "Locally adapted didactic materials to the Chinese context and, ultimately, bringing Brazil and China closer to the unique environment that Macau offers." Based on official documents and other studies on this theme, the authors consider that, in general terms, there is “the need for Brazil effectively to take advantage of Macau's strategic position to capitalize on these opportunities”. Noteworthy among the main points of this position is the fact that, in Macao, the policy of “a country, two systems”, being “an International Porto, an autonomous customs zone” and having “a simple and reduced tax regime”, is noted among Macao. , without forgetting the role of commercial platform. Academics also refer to the “Development Plan for Proper Economic Diversification of MSAR (2024-2028)” which “also offers opportunities, especially the promotion of key industries such as traditional Chinese medicine, the modern financial industry, state -of -the -art technology and MICE (meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions) and culture and sports. A weak bet Regarding China, Brazil is also not exploring every opportunity, João Simões and Daniel Veras highlight. "Brazil's foreign policy has actively promoted the Portuguese language in certain geographies, but has not given priority to China, despite the importance of the bilateral relationship between the two countries." It is stated that “the Portuguese language is expanding in China, but Brazil's participation is not up to its magnitude as the largest Portuguese-speaking country in the world”. It is argued that this “discrepancy is even more surprising if we consider that China has been Brazil's largest commercial partner since 2009”. The study highlights Victoria Almeida's position on the origin of Portuguese teachers in China, which “historically the teaching of Portuguese in China was referenced teachers from Portugal”. Thus, “only recently teachers in Brazil became more predominant”, and one of the explanations pointed out to this is the creation of the reader program, which sends teachers to teach Portuguese worldwide. The situation of this program is mentioned in 2010, when "13 readers were selected, two of which placed in China: one in Bisu and one at Guangdong University of Foreign Studies." Still, "Brazil's didactic materials are scarce, and although there are Chinese students who want to go to Brazil, these opportunities are limited and the costs are high." It is understood that Brazil “could take advantage of what is happening with the teaching of Portuguese in mainland China”, because “after years of rapid growth in the number of Portuguese apprentices, we are now in an investment phase in the so-called area studies. or regional ”. Thus, “Brazilian higher education and research institutions can contribute to the reinforcement of China's area studies on Lusophone and Latin America countries, through the investigation and analysis of social, economic, political and cultural dynamics of the target regions ”, Especially given the initiative“ a track, a route ”, is stressed by the authors. Portugal does better The study denotes that, despite the various exchanges between Brazilian and Chinese higher education, the truth is that “many more Chinese students return from exchanges in Portugal, whose best universities offer exchanges with Chinese students”, considering that “it will take a long time until that Brazil builds a teaching culture in China ”. Thus, “compared to Brazil, Portugal has a greater framing in the teaching of Portuguese abroad”, providing “Teaching Programs and Scholarships for Chinese Students”, Master's and PhD level, without forgetting “Partnership with the Camões Institute ”. “Portugal also facilitates the acquisition of titles, as well as promoting the translation of Portuguese novels in China. On the other hand, Brazil does not make such a structured effort. As a result, currently, most Chinese Portuguese-speaking students tend to use European Portuguese as a base or at least as a reference, ”he says. Thus, João Simões and Daniel Veras consider that “Brazil can capitalize on the current context, which encompasses several favorable factors, to adopt a more collaborative approach to the promotion of Portuguese language in China”. The study states that, currently, Portuguese is spoken by more than 264 million people on five continents, and this number is expected to rise to nearly 400 million people in 2050, with “the African continent responsible for the largest increase”, reinforcing The preponderance of Portuguese as one of the most spoken languages ​​in the southern hemisphere. In addition, Portuguese is an official or work language in 32 international organizations. With the arrival of Lula da Silva to the presidency of Brazil for the second time, the authors consider that he “has tried an approach to China”, namely in the commitment to join the initiative “a track, a route” and the appointment “of a representative permanent at the Macao Forum ”. The academics cite another author's idea regarding the existence of “distrust and reserve that Brazil has shown over the years in relation to the Macao Forum”. Greater involvement “can help to guarantee China access to vital resources and markets in Brazil and Africa, potentially contributing to China's food and internal energy security” as well as enhancing Macau as a “cultural channel between China and the World Lusophone ”. However, “although there is political will and a favorable environment in Macao, more concerted efforts will be needed by Brazil to materialize these opportunities,” is mentioned.

item.title: Chinese New Year | Tourism and trips boosted consumption
item.description:
Arrived to the end of Chinese New Year's holidays, official numbers do not lie: China has crossed an intense consumption period, especially related to travel and tourism. Between January 28 and this Tuesday, some destinations in the country broke records of visitors
It is at the beginning of each year that the economy expects the one of the high moments for tourism and consumption in China. The Chinese New Year represents not only a moment of family life, but also the opportunity for many Chinese to travel. This year, to celebrate the year of the serpent, millions of people traveled internally and also out of the country between January 28 and Tuesday, and according to Xinhua the numbers are impressive with regard to purchases or number of visitors in some Destinations. The Altay City Hall, in the Xinjiang Autonomous Region, is referred to as one of the great ski destinations in the country, having received between January 28 and 31 191,900 visitors, a tourist flow that generated 225 million yuan in revenues. The agency points out that "skiing has definitely became the most popular activity in Altay during the holidays," leading to "a record number of practitioners, more than 10,000, to visit Jiangjunshan's ski resort on February 2". This represented "an increase of 23 percent over the previous year." The Altay zone is famous for registering between 170 and 180 days of snow per year, and in the mountainous areas the average snow depth reaches between one and two meters. Another region of China that reached considerable numbers on the Chinese New Year holidays was Yangshuo County in the Autonomous Guangxi Zhuang region, thanks "to unique natural landscapes and rich cultural activities." Between January 28 and 30, this area received about 410,600 tourists, generating tourist revenues of 589 million Yuan. In turn, Lhasa (in Tibet) also registered an increase in the number of visitors. Between January 28 and Monday, the city received 1.95 million tourists, representing an increase of 20.6 percent over the previous year, and found in tourist revenues almost 1.76 billion Yuan. This is an increase of 14.75 percent compared to the previous year, according to the Lhasa Municipal Culture and Tourism Office. Positive data from agencies Also according to Xinhua, the Chinese New Year's numbers also revealed themselves on travel reserve platforms. In the case of Fliggy, one of the main online agencies, "an increase in reserves, especially for cities such as Shanghai, Beijing and Guangzhou" was recorded. On the other hand, "international travel orders have increased significantly, with international cruise reserves increasing more than six times compared to the previous year." Regarding air traffic, Shanghai Airport Group reported that passenger traffic on Sunday has reached a new historic record of 404,000 people, with Pudong Airport in Shanghai, to record 259,000 passengers and Hongqiao Airport 145,000 passengers. There was also a “reinforced coordination of the services of metro, buses and taxis to ensure transport without problems” with the arrival of the end of the holidays, said the group. On Monday, China State Railway Group Co., Ltd. recorded “a historic milestone” as they were transported on all railways a total of 16.45 million people. This is the “largest passenger traffic in a single day in the history of the Spring Festival Race”. Only this Tuesday, the last day of the holidays, will have traveled 16.9 million passengers, a number that highlights “even more the peak of travel, since hundreds of millions of people returned to their destinations after family meetings” . Comes and Babies As far as tourism is concerned, it was found “a growing number of people who sought to know the heritage of China, motivated by the registration of the Spring Festival in the representative list of UNESCO's Immaterial Cultural Heritage, in December 2024”, indicates the state agency. Data from the Ministry of Commerce show that sales in major retail and restoration companies throughout China, during the first four days of holidays, increased 5.4 percent compared to the same period last year. There was an increase in consumption of imported food and drinks, such as lobsters, beer and wine. "Due to increased demand during the Spring Festival, our company's imports increased almost 50 percent last month," said Yang Xinyu, who represents a company in the Guangzhou -based international supply chain. Since January that the customs authorities of Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport have enlarged the importation of food and crab products, 31.8 percent compared to 2024, translated the total of 14.3 million Yuan. Many online shopping And if the Chinese New Year is synonymous with family reunion, the holidays were once again a time for online shopping. Meituan, one of the country's leading electronic service platforms, has recorded an “impressive increase” of 300 percent over the previous year in online reserves for Lunar New Year's Eve. It should be noted that “group orders for packages with the theme 'intangible cultural heritage' have increased more than 12 times since January, year after year, reflecting the growing interest of consumers in cultural experiences.” Sun Jiashan, an associate researcher at the Central Academy of Culture and Tourism Administration, said, according to Xinhua, a change in consumer behavior, especially by young people and families. "Young families are increasingly becoming the driving force of consumption, with a tendency for diverse, high quality and culturally rich experiences," he said. Meituan Travel data corroborates the analyst's observation that young people increasingly choose to celebrate the Spring Festival in smaller cities, plunging into intangible cultural heritage and historical landmarks. The increase in tourism and cultural consumption, from equity experiences to successful films, indicate a growing demand for traditional and contemporary cultural activities. "This trend has also led to increased demand for cultural and tourist products and services, giving rise to the introduction of new models and business formats that adapt better to contemporary cultural consumption standards," Sun said, highlighting the potential of the Chinese consumer market and the internal driving forces of the economy. But not only shopping was made this Chinese New Year, as "the country's film industry proved to be one of the biggest winners during the spring festival's consumer wave." Between January 29 and February 3, the ticket daily revenues exceeded billion yuan for six consecutive days, raising the ticket offices of this year's Spring Festival to 8.02 billion yuans, According to China's movie administration data, China's total box office on this year's holidays, including real-time pre-sale, exceeded ten billion Yuan.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence | Study highlights China's leadership goal
item.description:
China aims to lead the global market of artificial intelligence, “both in terms of theory and application”, seeking self-sufficiency in this domain. This is one of the conclusions of Muhammed Can's PhD Thesis, “Artificial Intelligence as a resource: an evaluation of China's mobilization and extraction strategies”, defended at the University of Minho
A few months before the launch of the “DeepSeek” platform in China, which revolutionized the Artificial Intelligence (AI) market in competition with the chatgPT, was defended at the University of Minho (one) a doctoral thesis that precisely concludes, the ones Steps Beijing is taking to look for global leadership in this area. The work, by Muhammed Can, calls “Artificial Intelligence as Resource: An Appraisal of China's Mobilization and Extraction Strategies” [Artificial Intelligence as a resource: an evaluation of China's mobilization and extraction strategies], and analyzes the connection of the He went to international relations, as well as the strategy that the country has adopted in this domain in recent years. The thesis, in the area of ​​political science and international relations, was defended at the school of Economics and Management of UM. Thus, it is concluded that the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) “aims to become the world leader in both theory and AI-applications”, and some main objectives were outlined for “the process of resource mobilization and development AI ”. According to the author, they go through the “search for self-sufficiency, a view of 2015 strategy, 'Made in China 2025 ′”, as well as “economic transformation, with a view to perfectly integrating AI and automation in the national economy perfectly ”. Moreover, the author considers that Beijing seeks to become a competitor and leader in the AI ​​area to combat advances in other markets, namely in the United States, using initiatives such as the “Digital Silk Route of China and definition efforts of patterns as the way for external validation ”. Thus, "China's external resource extraction strategies are facilitated by the various economic mechanisms, aiming at the transfer of knowledge and talent acquisition, with the aim of filling out the resource gap with the United States." The “techno-nationalism” The thesis also speaks of the notion of “techno-nationalism”, linked to the area of ​​international relations, such as “the most important variable in China's AI policy”, and can also “be seen as a continuation and manifestation of the strategy of ' Two markets, two features' of the CCP ”. With this approach, China intends to "protect the domestic market and, simultaneously, expand abroad, promote the sale of products manufactured in China and extract resources such as data, talent, know-how and many others." In addition, “the implications of techno-nationalism also extend to foreign technological companies that operate in China”, since, “in the context of ordinary companies, China uses several barriers and takes advantage of its national legal framework as an instrument for an instrument for the strategic transfer of technology and specialized knowledge ”. Academic work takes into account the policies and laws implemented between 2012 and 2023, concluding that after the launch of the “New Generation Artificial Intelligence Development Plan” [NAIDP, in the English acronym], in 2017, the Chinese strategy for AI Won a new direction. "The thesis shows that the pace to which the resources were mobilized increased sharply after the announcement of NAIDP in 2017", having been revealed a set of "initiatives and plans related to AI, intended for systematic mobilization of essential resources for the development of I was ”. In the years referring to the study, “the CCP has enacted a series of data related policies and laws, including laws related to the privacy of individual data”, introducing “legal frameworks specifically related to national security, which have direct implications for governance and data regulation ”. The author also describes the way Beijing has adopted to mobilize all resources available around AI policy, with the Council of State “promulgating comprehensive strategic plans pertinent to AI or AI -related matters - such as the action plan Triennial Internet + Artificial Intelligence ”. It is these documents that will “articulate short and long term goals and standards, serving as a course for a coordinated development in this field”. Essential resources in developing AI projects and policies are “data, algorithms and computing capacity”. It should be noted that there is a “CCP resource mobilization strategy” that has the “approach of 'whole society' and 'whole government'”. Such "implies that all segments of society, including government institutions, private companies and individuals, may be involved in AI development effort if it is considered necessary." It is, according to the thesis, "an integrated approach that allows a more cohesive and comprehensive strategy for the mobilization of resources in the context of AI development." After “the introduction of global strategies”, the CCP “begins the process of mobilization of resources through designated government institutions”, namely ministries, the AI ​​promotion office and the China Cyberspace administration ”. “To improve its resource mobilization strategy, the CCP actively incorporates private actors in the AI ​​development ecosystem. By designating certain large technological companies such as AI national champions, the government not only mobilizes these companies, but also encourages them to mobilize more resources according to the state's strategic objectives ”, it reads. Importance of local governments Like in other fields, China realized early on that AI was an important area to invest and would have to be part of economic and political strategies. Thus, Muhammed Can's thesis "demonstrates that CCP changes in technological policy are closely aligned with the strategic environment," as the party "has realized opportunities and threats in significant global developments." Still regarding the mobilization of resources for the development of AI, the author speaks of a process “complex and distributed instead of a singular approach, from top to bottom, led only by the CCP or the State Council”. “Although the CCP establishes the general rules and guidelines, it actively involves a wide range of stakeholders - including companies, universities and ministerial bodies - in the mobilization process. This distributed strategy can be understood in the context of China's size, both in terms of population and geographical extension, which requires a more dispersed approach. ” The author highlights the “preponderant role that local governments play in the development of AI” because “they function as extensions of the central authority, and their active involvement implies direct mobilization of resources”, namely at the level of algorithms and computing capacity. "The thesis concludes that local governments have also instituted various strategies to improve policies associated with data, algorithms and computing capacity," can be read. “Some local governments took the initiative to formulate their own AI strategies before the central authorities issued official guidelines. Subsequently, these local strategies were reviewed to conform to the central directives. ” To analyze local AI policies, the author analyzed the cases of Shanghai and Shenzhen. Moreover, the idea of ​​mobilization around the AI ​​area is attached with historical issues, as Beijing has always sought the avant-garde in the technology area, namely since the Cold War times. As read in the thesis, “China began to rely heavily on exported technology from the Soviet Union after the creation of the Popular Republic of China”, but “the restrictive strategic environment began to evolve with the historic visit of US President Richard Nixon , in 1972 ”, having represented" an invaluable opportunity for China and the US counterbalances the Soviet threat. " Thanks to archive research, the author concludes that "China's strategic environment has moved to a partially permissive state around 1978, coinciding with the beginning of the reform and opening policies of leader Deng Xiaoping." From this year onwards, “a dramatic expansion of opportunities for the CCP in the field of technological development”. In general terms, "the concept of mobilization is intrinsically linked to the longtime vanguard role of the CCP, a role that facilitated the rapid mobilization of resources during key moments of its history." Not on purpose, China has participated since yesterday at the Summit about AI that takes place in Paris, the AI ​​action summit, having sent Deputy Prime Minister Zhang Quoqing. In this summit, which ends today, “heads of state, researchers and technology companies that will discuss how governments should respond to rapid advances in this domain are present,” according to Lusa.

item.title: Denmark | PM Refusal Sell Grolândia
item.description: Denmark Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen was yesterday available to dialogue with the United States over Granelândia, stressing that the autonomous territory “is not for sale”. "We have been very clear: we all have to respect the sovereignty of all states in the world - and Granelândia is today a part of the Denmark Kingdom - it is not on sale," he said. The Danish leader spoke at the entrance of the first EU leaders' retreat, an initiative created by European Council President António Costa for more informal debates. I totally agree with Americans that the region of the far north, the Arctic region, is increasingly important when we talk about defense and security and dissuasion, and it is possible to find a way to ensure a stronger [United States] footprint in Granelândia, where they are already, ”said Mette Frederiksen. The head of the Copenhagen government also recalled that Danish troops fought alongside the US for many decades. US President Donald Trump has claimed greater access to the Arctic and expressed the interest of acquiring Granelândia, an autonomous territory managed by Denmark.

item.title: USA | Trump will impose rates on “very soon” European products
item.description: United States President Donald Trump said European products will be subject to “very soon” customs rates following the imposition of tariffs on the importation of products from Canada, Mexico and China. “They are really enjoying us, we have a $ 300 billion deficit. They do not take our cars or our agricultural products, practically nothing, and we all bought millions of cars, huge levels of agricultural products, ”he said on Sunday to the press. The European Union lamented on the same day the increase in customs rates by the United States of America about products from Canada, Mexico and China, and said it will retaliate strongly if it is targeted by unfair tariffs. "The EU firmly believes that low customs rights promote economic growth and stability," the European Commission in a statement said through which he considered the imposition of more US tariffs as "harmful to all parties." If the European bloc is also the target of these measures, the community executive will “retaliate strongly”. Donald Trump signed on Saturday the executive order to apply customs rates to products from Canada, Mexico and China. The signature, which officializes the decision that had already been announced, determines the imposition of 10 percent rates to China, 25 percent to Mexico and 25 percent to Canada, except in Canadian oil, which will have a tariff of 10 by one hundred. Trump had threatened the imposition of tariffs to ensure greater cooperation from countries to prevent illegal immigration and the smuggling of chemicals such as Fentanil, an opioid that is causing important additions in the United States. The three countries promise to take action. Sacrifice (dis) necessary In the case of the European Union, a decision has not yet been made, but the concern is general and France defended on Sunday a "scathing response" of Europe in the face of threats of new customs tariffs by the US President. Trump admitted that the new rates can cause suffering to the American people, but has ensured that "everything will be worth it" because it will "make America big again." “Will there be suffering? Yes, maybe (and maybe not). But let's make America big again, and everything will be worth it, ”wrote Donald Trump, in capital letters, in the profile of the social network he founded, the Social Truth, quoted by the France-Presse news agency.

item.title: Study | Greater life satisfaction associated with relationships and money
item.description:
A study that evaluates life satisfaction in 65 countries and regions, including China, Taiwan and Hong Kong, concludes that in all countries financial security and a love relationship are key to happiness. However, during the pandemic there was a “great variability in global satisfaction”
What is necessary to have a full life with happiness? The question, which can have various connotations and spiritual trends, sought to be answered and quantified by the authors of the study “Life Satisfaction Around the World: Measurement Invariation of the Satisfaction With Life Scale (SWLS) Across 65 Nations, 40 Languages, Gender Identities, and Age groups ”[Life satisfaction around the world: Invariance on Life Sounding Scale (SWLS) in 65 countries, 40 languages, gender identities and age groups]. The study, recently edited by the academic magazine “Plos One”, started from analyzes made by dozens of academics and contributors in 65 countries and regions, including China, Taiwan and Hong Kong, which makes 57,000 people analyzed. In general terms, the authors conclude that "in all countries a greater satisfaction with life was significantly associated with financial security and the existence of a relationship of commitment or marriage." Thus, the results indicate that “greater satisfaction with life is significantly associated with greater financial security and higher educational qualifications (which may be an indicator of socioeconomic status, although the dimension of this specific relationship was insignificant)) ”. In general terms, “these results are consistent with the tests that indicate that the satisfaction of basic human needs and material well-being is a strong-possibly the strongest-predictor of psychological well-being and life satisfaction and life specifically". Admittedly, the authors draw attention to the fact that the idea of ​​well-being can vary from country to country depending on the culture of populations, but the results “suggest that, when considered at the individual level, the association between satisfaction with Life and indicators of material welfare seems to be relatively robust between nations. ” Regarding relationships, the answers hung more to the importance of not being alone. “We found that marital status was significantly associated with life satisfaction. More specifically, we found that respondents in commitment relationships were more likely to report more life satisfaction than non -married. This result is consistent with the widest literature that shows that marital status is a robust correlate of psychological well-being. ” However, a satisfactory life is not directly linked exclusively to love relationships, and can also occur when the person has an active social life. "It has been suggested that the formation and maintenance of social relations is fundamental to the promotion of life satisfaction, particularly in cultures or communities that emphasize family values, because they satisfy a basic human need for belonging and are a source of positive affirmation." . In addition, it "reinforces healthy behaviors and protects against the impact of negative events." Thus, the study considers it to be "likely that people living in commitment relationships can report greater emotional support and social integration, which, in turn, contributes independently to life satisfaction." COVID-19 TIMES If socialization is regarded as very important to a satisfactory life, as it was in Covid-19 times, which forced long periods of confinement and isolation? The study resorted to specific and statistics to evaluate the issue, concluding that there was “great variability in global satisfaction with life in the context of Covid-19 pandemic. The respondents in Canada (Francophone) and Israel had the highest SWLs and respondents in Japan and Ukraine to have the lowest averages. ” Given the large dimension of the sample, the results allow you to conclude “that life satisfaction varied substantially among national groups at the height of the covid-19 pandemic, although the authors highlight,“ care is necessary to be careful when interpreting them Latent averages ”referred to at work so as not to advance with definitive conclusions. Still, academics understand that these data may be important to when "professionals and political decision makers try to understand differences in life satisfaction between nations," as well as being a "way to better support subjective well-being in the era Postpandmic ”. Also noteworthy is the least life satisfaction by the minority population groups. “We found that identification as part of a racialized minority was associated with less life satisfaction. Although this is consistent with some previous works and probably reflects the deleterious effect of the experiences of racism on life satisfaction, it should be noted that the dimension of the effect of this relationship was insignificant. ” In addition, the authors point out that “urbanity was associated with life satisfaction in a little significant way”, having been evaluated if living in a city or other urban context changed the level of satisfaction with life. Means and purposes To reach data from the SWLS scale described above, the “Body Image In Nature Inquiry” (Bins, English) was made by 253 scientists or academics of the 65 countries involved, who collected data between November 2020 and February 2022. In total, 56,968 people were interviewed, 58.9 percent were women, 40.5 percent men and 0.6 percent were of another gender identity. In terms of race and ethnicity, the majority, 74.2 percent, "identified as part of a racialized majority," while 11.3 percent "identified as part of a racialized or minority ethnic group." Regarding the site where participants live, 27 percent said living in a capital, 13.7 percent in the suburb of a capital, 25.1 percent in a city of province, that is, with more than 100 thousand inhabitants; While 18.7 percent said residing in a province town with more than 10,000 inhabitants. Only 15.5 percent of respondents lived in a rural area. As for literary qualifications, 33.5 percent ended higher education, 42 percent were single and 19.5 percent were in a “commitment relationship, but were not married”. In turn, 33.5 percent were married. Regarding financial security, 24.9 percent of participants reported feeling less safe than others of their age in their country of residence, while 49.6 percent said they felt “equally safe” and 25.5 percent They considered to be "safer". Inquiry data allowed the study authors to “examine associations between life satisfaction and the main sociodemographic variables at the level of the individual”. Factors such as “Life Satisfaction”, “Financial Security” and “Urbanity” were evaluated, in which participants filled SWLs using a 7 -point response scale, where 1 point represented “totally disagree” and 7 points "I totally agree." Demographic data such as age, education, marital status or race were also evaluated. With regard to China, the country is divided between “China - Cantonese”, “China - English” and “China - Mandarin”. In the case of “China - Cantonese”, regarding Hong Kong, 409 people responded, with 58 percent of women and only two percent of respondents belonging to a racial minority. All participants live in urban context, while 96 percent ended secondary or higher education. Of respondents, only two percent says it is in a relationship, whether or not marriage. In the case of “China - Mandarin” 1,231 people participated, 69 percent of which women, in which 95 percent resides in urban areas. 86 percent of respondents have a commitment or relationship.

item.title: Press | Kou Hoi in did not make statements at l lunch
item.description: As president of the Legislative Assembly, Kou Hoi in broke with the tradition of lunch with the media to answer the journalists' questions. Yesterday, the entrepreneur again maintained his posture adopted, and although he made the traditional speech was not available to be questioned. This is a stance that contrasts much contrasts with the one adopted by Ho Iat SENG, as president of the Legislative Assembly, which reserved almost half an hour to answer the questions raised by the media. All About Macau | Barrado newspaper at the entrance In the image of the posture adopted by the Public Administration and the Executive Bodies, the Chinese language newspaper All About Macau was again prevented from participating in the events for the media, this time by the Legislative Assembly. According to the report made by the publication, contrary to what happened in previous years, the publication was not invited to the event, despite having made at least two contacts with the organizers. Yesterday, during the event, the journalists asked for access to the room, but were told that there were no places available. However, inland there were at least 30 places for occupying. item.title: AL | Kou Hoi in enhances 2024 as the year with the most filled schedule
item.description: Last year forced the extra efforts of deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL). This was one of the tones of yesterday's speech of the president of the legislature, Kou Hoi In, regarding the spring lunch of the members of the AL and representatives of the media. Despite the “overloaded agenda”, Kou Hoi In praised the “active and programmatic attitude” and “sense of mission and responsibility” of the deputies. With the entry into the final line of this legislature, the president of AL predicted that the beginning of the sixth term of the government, "makes it foresee that the work in the coming times is even more intense." For now, in this last legislative session, nine proposals were approved in general who are under consideration in the specialty in permanent commissions, as well as a project of resolution. But, for now, the legislative agenda will be marked by the first presentation of the report of the government lines of the new executive led by Sam Hou Fai. In a retrospective about last year, Kou Hoi in stressed the ephemeris of the double anniversary of Mashere and the implementation of the Popular Republic of China, as well as the third anniversary of the creation of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin. However, for the president of AL, the highest moment was the state visit of Xi Jinping to Macao, which "reinforced confidence in the advantages inherent to the formula" a country, two systems "and the development landscape it provided." The compliment of nationalism, patriotic love and national security were the first highlights listed by Kou Hoi In in terms of legislative work. "We have always taken the defense of national sovereignty, and the safety and interests of state development as guiding principles of legislative work developed by the hemiciclo," he said. For this purpose, the deputy stressed the law of control of weapons and related things, passed last year, as "a solid legal guarantee for the construction of a line of defense of national security." Firm hands The implementation of the “Macao Macao governed by patriots” principle was the second point of the discourse of the president of the AL, which ensures that “the power of Macao's governance is firmly in the hands of those who love the homeland and Macao”. In this chapter, Kou Hoi in enumerated the electoral laws to the executive head and the Legislative Assembly, as well as the Law of Oaths at the time of possession. "The approval of these three legislative initiatives was essential to ensure, on the one hand, that the election of the sixth chief executive had been successfully completed," offering "guarantees of a disciplinary framework applicable to the next elections for the 8th Legislative Assembly, to take place this year ”. Finally, Kou Hoi In mentioned the works regarding the reform of administrative management and electronic government, optimization of the business environment, raising the efficiency of governance and public services.

item.title: Coutinho warns of distributing “material offers” thinking about elections

When asked about this year's elections, José Pereira Coutinho considered that it would be positive if the Nova Esperança list, supported by the ATFPM, kept a place of the two current. "There is already movements in society, in terms of offers, tours, gifts and so on ... I'm quite reticent ... keeping a place on the new hope would be an excellent result for the next elections of the Legislative Assembly," said the member of the Legislative Assembly. “Things are changing dramatically, and it is not easy, given material attractions such as offers, tours, and everything else, as well as the unequal treatment of TDM in Chinese channels, where deputies are invited to speak, both in the programs of Radio, want on television, ”he said. “If we take into consideration me, I would say that in recent years the Chinese TDM station has not requested me opinions or invited to the 8:30 am, the Macao Forum. There is an unequal treatment, ”he said. List by deciding Since 2005 José Pereira Coutinho has been the head of the new hope list. However, last year, it was announced that Rita Santos would run for elections in an eligible place. Regarding the distribution of places, José Pereira Coutinho sent decisions for the management meeting, which should take place by the end of the week.
