To journalists, Pereira Coutinho also stressed that it was important to elect a deputy who speaks Portuguese and lamented that in the public administration, and in the Legislative Assembly, we are watching the disappearance of people with the ability to express themselves in what is also an official language in Macao.

item.title: Legislative | Ron Lam has not decided to compete for the next elections
item.description:
Few resources and a reduced support structure make Ron Lam have not yet decided to advance with the reconditeration of the next direct elections for the Legislative Assembly. Regardless of the decision, it ensures that it will continue to make its contribution to society by giving voice to the opinions of the population
“My support group is very small and we have limited resources. Therefore, we have not yet considered reelection. ” This is how Ron Lam left open yesterday the possibility of not relying on the next legislative elections, revealing that he has not made a decision. In fact, the deputy added that the possibility of seeking reelection has not yet been "deeply discussed." However, it has guaranteed something emotionally that even if it is left out of the next legislature will continue to intervene politically in Macao. "If after a full consideration, our position is to help society otherwise, we will help to give voice to the opinions of the population and continue this work," he said yesterday on the Spring Lunch of the Legislative Assembly. Moreover, Ron Lam lamented that in the nearly two months of the new government of Sam Hou Fai the communication with the population only assumed the format of press release, without communicating directly with people. The deputy pointed out that this situation is not very common, although it is already from the previous executive, leaving in the population an image that "is not ideal." Urgent things Ron Lam also stated that the population of Macao expects the government's short-term measures to address problems that require quick answers. "The population expects concrete measures in the presentation of the next lines of government action in the areas of employment, economy and increased social support," he said. However, before a medium and long term course is traced, the deputy understands to be a priority the relief of the deep impact by the most economically vulnerable population. To this end, it will be necessary to distribute again valleys or incentive cards to consumption, "so that the society's base layer improve its situation." At the level of employment, the deputy wants measures that guarantee priority to workers residing in the large companies that operate in the territory. Ron Lam thinks that only this way the government can “retain the confidence of the population”, and after the implementation of urgent measures, yes, it can advance to medium and long term policies, such as the proper diversification of the economy.

item.title: Portugal Day | Marcelo in the celebrations in Macau
item.description:
Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa's passage has no date yet, but will fall into the celebration of Portugal's Day, Camões and Portuguese communities, in a year when official celebrations will take place in Lagos, Algarve, and then in Macao
The President of the Republic of Portugal, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, will mark in Macau the Day of Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese communities, June 10, although the dates of the visit are not yet defined. The information was advanced during the weekend by Radio Macau, and later confirmed by Alexandre Leitão, consul of Portugal in Macau and Hong Kong. “It is the confirmation of information that in the consulate many honors us and I think that honors the Portuguese community. It is a gesture of recognition by the President of the Republic of the relevance and dimension of the Portuguese community, which as we know is not restricted to the Portuguese immigrants, expatriates, Portuguese from Portugal, but all those who have Portuguese nationality and live in Macau and that are many. There are many tens of thousands, ”said Alexandre Leitão, in statements to the station. "I am sure that the Portuguese community is brothers in the same joy and satisfaction and that together we will know how to receive the President of the Republic with the gratitude that this gesture deserves to us," he added. Also to the Macau channel, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, president of the Macaense Instruction Promoter Association was pleased with the news. “Obviously it is not just a mere view, it is a visit by the President of the Republic, linked to a special day that is June 10. It is not every day that Macau receives a visit from the President of the Republic, although it is not the first time, ”he began by highlighting Senna Fernandes. “It is always good to know what the Portuguese state thinks about Macau, the presence of Portuguese culture […] beyond the discourses we are used to listening, it is important to know how the Portuguese state sees the presence of the Portuguese community in Macau. These are the questions I will ask if I have the opportunity to do so, ”he admitted. Miguel de Senna Fernandes also considered that Portugal politicians tend not to know what is happening in the territory. "The politician always says that he is aware of what is happening, but there are nothing aware of what is happening in Macao," he said. "It was good to elucidate us about the position of the Portuguese state in view of the presence of this community, from the radical community, Autocho de Macao," he said. Designated by Marcelo The information that Macao had been designated as one of the places where the June 10 celebrations will take place was released on the Presidency of the Republic of Portugal, through a press release. "The President of the Republic designated the city of Lagos as headquarters of the celebrations, in 2025, Portugal Day, Camões and Portuguese communities, extending the celebrations to the Portuguese community in Macao," was written in the statement. “For the organization of the celebrations, a commission presided by Dr. Lídia Jorge, writer, and who is part of the Chief of Staff of the Armed Forces, the Secretary-General of the Presidency of the Republic and the head of the State Protocol ”, Was added In December last year, Marcelo had stated that he was able to celebrate the last 10 June of his term with the Portuguese emigrant communities of places such as Asia Pacific, Australia, Macao or Goa. This will be the second visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa as President, Macao, after a first ticket, in 2019.

item.title: Australia interdicts social networks to children under 16 (II)
item.description:
Last week, we mentioned that the Australian Parliament approved the amendment to the “Internet Security Law (minimum age for access to social networks) on November 28, 2024, interdicting access from under 16 to most networks. The content of the law is simple, but from the point of view of its operation, there are several issues that deserve to be debated. First of all, Australia is not the first country to legislate this matter. In Europe, many countries have already restricted children's access to social networks. The established minimum age varies from country to country, but usually between 13 and 17 years old. Secondly, in Florida, the United States, the restriction of access from children under 13 to social networks triggered a process by limiting freedom of expression. The same may happen in Australia after the implementation of the new law and this will be a risk that the Australian government will have to run. Third, when one identifies a minor that transgresses the law, only the company that manages the social network is punished. The minor and parents are not considered responsible. In this sense, the law fails as a disciplinary. This approach can lead to conflicts around the assignment of liability when it comes into force. Some question whether this means to blame for social networks, ignoring the pedagogical responsibilities of families. There may be two reasons why the new law does not criminally responsible for infrastructors. First, as social networks are very popular, people generally use them, and those under 16 are easily influenced. Second, laws may predict different minimum ages for infrastructors to assume criminal liability. In Australia, the age of criminal liability is between 10 and 14 years, which means that certain transgressors aged between 10 and 14 may assume a certain degree of criminal responsibility. The new law increases the age of criminality in two years, apparently to allow users under 16 to avoid being held responsible and to prevent more children from breaking the law due to their tender age. But, on the other hand, if we only punish social networking companies that provide the tools for children to violate the law, the responsibility will only fall into these companies? Isn't this a way to put the car ahead of the oxen? In Australia, there is a new law in force to which social networking companies have to obey. However, in countries where there is no restrictions on the use of social networks by children, personal technology companies may consider establishing some restrictions to deny minors access to these networks. For example, Tiktok, Facebook and Snapchat have stipulated the minimum age of 13 years for their users. The restrictions imposed by these companies can benefit their image and reduce criticism from children's access permission to networks. Industry self-regulation is an effective way to reduce the impact of social networks on children. Fourthly, the new law requires social networking companies to take measures to verify the age of users. There are currently three viable methods of age verification: biometric analysis, online activities verification and identity document verification. Biometric analysis implies that users send a photo to the platform for the software to determine their age. It is not known if the photo will be eliminated after the age determination process is completed. Online activity verification requires users to provide their email account and, from there, an analysis will be based on the accounts related to the account. Verification of identity documents is another possibility of determining the age of users. It is unlikely to be accurately evaluated whether a user is over 16 years old based on photos or based on his online activity. However, the new law clearly stipulates that users cannot carry identity documents on social network companies' platforms, which will make the process of determining their age difficult. If the three age determination methods have problems, it is questionable that the new law can be implemented without startles. No wonder the goal, the mother company of Alphabet's Google, Facebook and Instagram, has declared in a presentation in the Australian parliament that expects the new law to be postponed until the age test will be completed. A goal spokesman said Facebook respects Australian law, but is concerned about the process in which they have rushed to pass legislation to ensure an age of access to social networks, but ignoring the opinions of others. Next week we continue our analysis.

item.title: The (in) justice we have
item.description: For many decades we met a judge, we had studied together, who was homosexual. A magistrate of excellence, from professional virtuosity to all the introvert evidence, has never taken any less dignified attitude towards his subordinates and even severely condemned an admittedly homosexual individual who had sexually abused a minor. At that time it was a scandal if it came to know that the judge was homosexual and would certainly be expelled from the judiciary. One day he confessed to me that he had a single and secret companion almost his age. I pretended that I did not give importance to the outburst and always had the ease of obtaining important information about legal proceedings that the judge was kind to provide me as a journalist. My comrades were surprised how I had such credible court sources and even asked the origin. Obviously they never got any response on my part. This comes by justice that in Portugal we have judges and judges of very high degree of competence, seriousness and independence. Absolutely incorruptible. And we have others who simply fulfill their mission with the aim of obtaining the greatest possible peculio. These facts have happened over decades. Before and after the military coup of April 25, 1974. Recently, we all were aware of the shameful attitude of Judge Rangel who was to the point of handing over to a trainee lawyer to write the judgments that were distributed to him. These judgments, which rangel or neither read or only provided the intern the indications that he was in. As it would have to happen, Rangel was expelled from the judiciary. We, from our own experience, had an exceptional unofficial defender, of a peculiar competence that dedicated themselves to the process as if they were receiving a lot of money. Last week, the country was aware of a scandal related to a judge accused of paying poor minors for sex. A jubilant magistrate from the Azores paid 25 euros to minors each time he had sex. It turns out that the theme that involves incompetent, corrupt and now pedophiles cannot be unpunished and should be the target of the biggest debate on the part of society. Jubilated Judge Manuel Mota Botelho is now being tried for 16 crimes of resorting to the prostitution of minors. The crimes will have occurred between 2019 and 2023 in São Miguel, in the Azores. item.title: Macao in 2025
item.description: After taking office as a sixth chief executive of Macao, Sam Hou Fai announced that in the next five years he would strive to realize the four great visions: "Macau founded in the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." Will these four views be really realized in 2025, the first year of the new Government of MSAR? To achieve these four objectives, RAE's sixth government has to actively engage with patriotic organizations for communication and exchange purposes, and take government officials to Beijing to listen to Xia Baolong's instructions, the Director of the Work Office Hong Kong and Macao from the Communist Party Central Committee of China and the Hong Kong and Macao affairs office with the Council of State. All of this will be necessary to prepare the first report of the Governing Lines of Action to be presented by the Sixth Government of MSAR. Based on reports from all over, and changes from members of the Management Committee and the Executive Committee of the Deepened Cooperation Zone between Guangdong and Macao in Hengqin, it seems that the “integration of Macao and Hengqin” will probably be a priority topic of the future policies of RAE. This is because this is a national policy defined by the central government for the sectoral diversification of the Macao industry and for the efficient integration of Macau in the Great Guangdong-Hong Bay Kong-Macau. Although the path has already been opened, to prevent Macao from becoming confused with any other city in the interior of China, the proposal of the four visions is undoubtedly necessary. The question that remains is how to reach them. Firstly, about the view of “Macao founded in the rule of law”, some scholars believe that “the law should not just be a tool for the government to control society. If we want to speak of a rule of law, the people must also be able to exercise control over government action through the law; This bilateral supervision is what constitutes the rule of law. Otherwise, the “rule of law” would mean controlling the people through legal provisions. Therefore, the concept of Sam Hou Fai of “Macao based on the rule of law” must be persecuted in the direction of the rule of law, and not through the formulation or alteration of legal documents to control the people and society. As for the creation of the “dynamic Macao”, the key is to break the limitations of the region. Otherwise, the coming of more tourists will only make the whole city chaotic, moving away from the goal of becoming the world center of tourism and leisure. To increase the vitality of Macao, it is necessary to expand its territory. Hengqin is no longer a new zone directly under jurisdiction in the city of Zhuhai to become a deepened cooperation zone built and run jointly by Guangdong and Macau province. The next step is undoubtedly moving towards the integration of Macau and Hengqin. Anyone with a basic understanding of public administration knows that having two power centers and two leadership teams often affects administrative efficiency and reduces its effectiveness due to the lack of unified authority. Therefore, when the central government fully transfer the administration of Hengqin to Macau, it should also be the time to materialize the "dynamic Macau". Macau has only a few hundred years of history compared to the thousands of years of China's cultural heritage. But what makes Macau stand out among many Chinese cities? The sino-Portuguese cultural and religious fusion. The files of the Diocese of Macao, Synical Sheets, and “Files and Manuscripts of the Kong Tac Lam Macau Temple (1645-1980)” were included in the registration of the memory of the UNESCO world to ASIA and PACIFIC, which fully demonstrates to Singularity of Macao's culture. If this advantage can be used, transforming Macau into “Macao Cultural” should not be difficult As for the “Macao Happy” view, it should be the main priority of the Government of MSAR. After pandemic, affected by several internal and external factors, Macau's small and medium -sized companies faced difficulties, and social progress lacks driving force, with the increase of suicide incidents. The Government of MSAR has the responsibility of preventing Macau, “governed by patriots”, becomes a tragic city. For Macao residents to feel happy, it is essential to concentrate not only in the material aspects, but also in their mental well-being. With the strong support of the central government and Sam Hou Fai's efforts and his team, 2025 is expected to be the best year of the next decade.

item.title: Book dedicated to Carlos Paredes includes unpublished recording of show
item.description: The life and work of guitar master Carlos Paredes, who “created a genuinely Portuguese song out of nowhere”, is told in a book to be presented this week in Portugal and which includes the recordings of two concerts, one of which is unprecedented. In “Carlos Paredes - the guitar of a people”, the researcher Octávio Fonseca begins to tell the guitarist's route before he was born, reminiscent of his family background. Carlos Paredes, who would complete a hundred years of life on February 16, descend from a family of guitarists and composers: great-grandfather António Rodrigues Paredes, grandfather Gonçalo Rodrigues Paredes, grand-uncle Manuel Rodrigues Paredes and father, Artur Paredes. According to Octávio Fonseca, Artur Paredes, “in terms of technique, completely revolutionized the guitar of Coimbra”, and Carlos Paredes “took advantage of this work and simplified it”. To tell the story and stories of Carlos Paredes, Octávio Fonseca resorted to the research work he had done to another book dedicated to the guitarist edited in 2000, which included reading articles on music that 'master' wrote in newspapers and interviews that gave to various media. But to write this book, she featured “the extraordinary collaboration” of guitarist and songwriter Luísa Amaro, companion of walls. "Most of the stories that are told in the book were she who conveyed to me," he said. What makes Carlos Paredes a unique artist is, for Octavio Fonseca, the fact that he created “genuinely Portuguese music of nowhere”. “In the late 1960s, early 1970s, we were very discussing to go to traditional roots, to create a Portuguese popular music, as José Afonso did. But Carlos Paredes did not do that, and created a Portuguese song out of nowhere. He did not start from our traditional song, nor from any experience of Portuguese music, ”said the researcher. The parallelism between José Afonso and Carlos Paredes was pointed out by the guitarist himself. “He says in two interviews that there is a parallel between him and José Afonso at the beginning of his career. Carlos Paredes's first album is from 1962 and José Afonso's first ballad album as well (he had albums before, but it was from Fado de Coimbra). They both make a new song from Coimbra, ”he said. The following year, the two musicians “break free from Coimbra, from the song of Coimbra”, but with a difference, “while with José Afonso there is a complete cut, with Carlos Paredes there is a cut, but there are always a 'penguinhos' in the compositions in which Coimbra appears ”. MUSICAL NEWS “Carlos Paredes - the guitar of a people” is accompanied by two records. One is “Master of the Portuguese Guitar”, an album recorded in 1977, at the 7th Political Song Festival in Berlin, published this year by her friend, editor of the former German Democratic Republic (RDA), which is unprecedented in Portugal. In the other album is recorded “The First Show Carlos Paredes made in his own name in Portugal”, an unprecedented recording registered on March 31, 1984, at the Carlos Alberto Theater, in Porto. The book also includes a photo portfolio by Carlos Paredes, by Augusto Cabrita, Luís Paulo Moura and Inácio Ludgero. The musician lived mainly in Lisbon and the city inspired many of his compositions. “Green Years”, one of the best known of his work, was composed for the homonymous film of Paulo Rocha, milestone of the new Portuguese cinema of the 1960s. Anti-fascist combatant, opposed the dictatorship and was arrested by PIDE in the late 1950s. Until the 1990s, it reconciled the guitar with its administrative activity at the São José Hospital in Lisbon. In December 1993, he was diagnosed with myelopathy, a disease that attacked him the bone structure and that prevented him from playing guitar.

item.title: Cinema | ‘Nezha 2’ becomes the most viewed movie in China's history
item.description: The ‘Nezha 2’ animation became the most viewed movie in China's history, days after hitting the revenue record, reaching 5.8 billion Yuan. On Sunday, ‘Nezha 2’ exceeded the film of Wolf Warrior (2015), also Chinese, reaching 159 million tickets sold, according to data from the Specialized Portal Maoyan. Both ‘Nezha 2’ and the prequel, ‘Nezha’ (2019), are based on a 16th -century Chinese classic novel called "Investiture of the Gods." The film, which premiered during Lunar New Year's holidays, captivated viewers for the narrative, cultural impact and visual quality, according to Chinese official news agency Xinhua. Maoyan predicts that production can become the first movie to raise more than 10 billion Yuan in the Chinese market. The success of ‘Nezha 2’ is a breath of fresh air for an industry in trouble: in 2024, the Chinese box office raised 42.502 billion yuan, less 22.5 percent than in 2023. Chinese productions dominated the domestic market in 2024, generating 78.7 percent of total revenues. Chinese authorities limit the number of foreign films, with a quota system that allows the display of about 35 productions per year. The drop in revenues in 2024 was a setback for a sector that had already been affected during the rigorous Zero Covid politics, which led to the closing of thousands of movie theaters and the functioning of others with boundaries in the number of spectators.

item.title: Super Bowl | Artist detained after unfurling Sudanese-Palestinian flag
item.description: An artist who acted during the break of Super Bowl, the final of the Football Championship (NFL), was arrested on the field after unfurling a Sudanese-Palestinian flag with the words "Sudan" and "Gaza" written. The NFL confirmed that the detainee was part of a list of about 400 artists who participated in the show during the interval of Sunday's game, where the star was rapper Kendrick Lamar. The New Orleães Police Department said in a statement that "police are working to determine the accusations applicable in this incident." "The individual will be banned forever from all NFL stadiums and events," said NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy in a statement. The artist climbed to a used car during Lamar's action and raised the flag. The NFL said that "the individual hid the item with him and revealed it at the end of the program" and that "no one involved in production was aware of the intention of the individual." Roc Nation, an entertainment company that produced the show, said the act "was not planned or part of the production and was never rehearsed." The concert continued without interruption, and so far there was no confirmation that the flag was seen during the transmission of Lamar's performance. The Philadelphia Eagles were sacred NFL champions for the second time as they prevented an unprecedented Kansas City Chiefs 'tri', who beat 40-22 on the 59th Super Bowl in New Orleães, Luisiana.

item.title: Boi Warehouse | Huang Xuan Dreams presented this Saturday
item.description:
“I have too Much to Dream Last Night” [I had a lot to dream of last night] is the name of the new exhibition of artist Huang Xuan that reveals itself to the public, starting this Saturday, in the ox warehouse, and that results from a Artistic residency in Macau. At the inauguration there will be no shortage of music, with the presence of DJ Rui Farinha
It is already this Saturday, 15, that a new show will be inaugurated at the Boi Warehouse, the result of a three -week artistic residency with the artist Huang Xuan. This is “I Had Too Much To Dream Last Night” [I had a lot to dream last night], which was developed “with involvement in local life and numerous contacts with the community”, with the artist investigated “the structure and the cultural context of the city ”. During the period of artistic residency in Macao, which lasted between October and November last year, Huang Xuan “observed how workers, tourists seeking leisure and individuals holding resource -owned individuals in the corners of the city, impregnating the site with Your unique spirit and meaning, ”describes a note from the ox warehouse. It was there that, "from the rhythm of the windows that open on the facades of the buildings, it became possible to imagine the daily movements, the conversations and sounds of the people inside." The exhibition includes works that portray "objects left behind along the paths of the city," or even "marks erased on the persistent walls and smells of food on the streets, which offer glimpse of moments that have passed." On the show that the public can see in the ox warehouse until March 17, “the city breathes and pulsates in tune with the built environment, the economic activities and daily routines of its inhabitants”, in a creative space where “as the City lights increase and decrease, with deep sounds and silences to emerge, ”where“ each resonance encapsulates the distinct cadence of urban life ”. Multidisciplinary show This is a individual exhibition of the artist who knew how to merge very diverse creative elements such as photography, video, installation and performance to rewrite the city's narrative, “as it is seen and felt through its outlaw perspective”. Thus, according to the ox warehouse, “it is possible to find objects, stopped or moving, to witness the transformation of urban scenes and functions, to observe stained and re -configured symbols in reconfigured forms and perceive the change of patterns and directions in the daily flow of time”. . It is an “abstract narrative that unfolds like a daily stage of celebrations that have already ended, where actors, objects and even the stage itself repeat or get involved in a meditative and automatic performance after the cloth has fallen,” he describes himself . Huang Xuan was born in 1995 in Taipei, Taiwan. According to a biographical note shared by the ox warehouse on social networks, most of his works are performances and films, where he “uses his own body as material, using simple but persistent movements, as a scale to test the environment”, and besides being "Explore many subtle limitations and routine operations of everyday life." On Saturday, after the inauguration, which starts at 5:30 pm, there will be music with DJ Rui Farinha, with the party starting at 18:30. The ox warehouse is located between Colonel Mesquita's Avenue and Almirante Lacerda Avenue.

item.title: Concert | Burlada on 8,900 yuan when buying tickets
item.description: A man was circumvented in 8,900 yuan while trying to buy, over the internet, tickets for a concert in the interior. The case was released yesterday by the Judicial Police (PJ), who received the complaint. According to the contours presented by PJ, the victim was added to the Wechat platform in May last year for a contact he did not know. However, it found that this contact sold tickets to different concerts in the black market. So in June last year, the man decided to buy two tickets for a concert, making a payment of 8,900 yuan. The concert was scheduled for July, but was postponed to January this year. In the face of scheduling, the man contacted the alleged seller, who assured him that he would send him the new tickets in time from the new show. However, this never happened, and the victim eventually filed a complaint to the Macao authorities.

item.title: Game | Citigroup makes review at low growth
item.description:
With many of the largest gamblers to be owners of companies that export to the United States, the investment bank believes Donald Trump's fares will have an indirect impact on Macau
The Citigroup Investment Bank has reduced the game sector's growth forecasts for more than half for more than half. The decrease was explained by what was considered the poor performance of casinos during the Lunar New Year, traditionally one of the highest times of tourism, as well as the impact of Donald Trump's tariffs on Chinese exports to the United States. According to the Investment Bank, quoted by the GGR Asia Portal, most VIP players in Macao casinos are home to factories, often with export -facing businesses, including the United States. Therefore, the bank considers that there is a risk that these players see their income affected, with 10 percent rates on imports in the United States for Chinese products, which will have consequences in the amount available to play, as well as willingness to come to Macau. According to the new forecast, Citigroup estimates that the game's gross gross revenues record a growth of 3 percent, which contrasts with the previous forecast, which indicated a growth of 7 percent. And in the first half of the year, the investment bank admits that gross revenues even record a reduction of about 1 percent. Below the expected From the perspective of Citigroup, the game industry generated averages of 589 million patacas a day in January and “about 900 million patacas” per day in the early days of February, which represents a below expected value. The first four days of February have already covered the period of celebrations of the year Lunar. The bank has attributed the revenue levels disappointing to “some last -minute cancellations to Macau by the players”, which took place in the last days of the festivities. "These two data make us more cautious about the short-term trends of the game's recipes," wrote analysts George Choi and Timothy Chau, in the report quoted by the GGR Asia portal. "We believe that the implementation of US tariffs against China on February 1 has reduced the search for the game at the end of the new year and anticipated that this impact will continue for most of the first half of 2025," he was justified. “According to the current trend, if we join the revenues of January and February, we can see a negative trend,” he was added. Distinct stories Despite the pessimism for the first half of the year, the situation should improve in the second phase, with Citi indicating that it expects a “milder picture in June”. "We hope that the feeling of players will start to recover in the second half of 2025, as the impact of [American] tariffs is being digested," he was pointed out. As one of the factors of optimism for the second half of the year, Citi points out that the search for game tables should “accelerate as big events return to Macau”, indicating as an example the show of actor and singer Jacky Cheung, scheduled For June at the Galaxy Arena.

item.title: FDCT | launched financing program with Lusophone countries
item.description: The Fund for the Development of Science and Technology (FDCT) of Macao launched this year a new program to fund scientific and technological investigation with the abroad, including Lusophone countries. “Financing is available for cooperation investigation projects with any Portuguese -speaking country; No preference is given to any particular country, ”the FDCT told Lusa. Each of the projects approved under the External Cooperation Funding Program in Science and Technology could receive up to five million Patacas, the fund added. "Given that this is the inaugural year of this program, the exact number of projects to be funded will be decided based on the quality and number of applications received," said the FDCT. The fund organized a clarification session on this January 20 and other project financing programs, which had about 300 representatives of higher education institutions, scientific associations and technological companies in Macao. However, according to the FDCT portal on the Internet, there is no date for opening the applications for the Funding Program for External Science and Technology Cooperation. Still, the fund said that applications for the new program will be open for a maximum of two months. "To encourage more collaborations, there will be no specific priority areas in terms of technology," added the FDCT. "Any project that can help improve Macao's investigation capabilities and fulfill the eligibility criteria will have the chance to receive funding," the fund said.

item.title: Electric | Joe Chan says it is impossible to achieve inland goals
item.description:
Although last year 31.4 percent of the new vehicles recorded in the territory are electric, the president of Macau Green Student Union does not believe that the renewal of the Auto Park in Macau can achieve the objectives proposed by the interior
Environmentalist Joe Chan Chon Meng told Lusa that it is “absolutely impossible” Macau to reach the goal for electric vehicles in mainland China, from 45 percent of new sales by 2027. In early January, the Chinese government released a list of objectives Environmental, which includes a rise review of the previous goal for electric vehicles, which was 20 percent by 2025. In the second half of last year, the tramful ones represented more than half of the sales of new vehicles, according to data from the China passenger automobiles association. In Macao, 31.4 percent of the new vehicles recorded in 2024 were electric, according to official data. But the president of Macau Green Student Union stressed that fossil -powered vehicles “continue to represent a great proportion” of the territory park. At the end of December, Macau had a total of 253,182 vehicles, of which 12,302 vehicles (4.8 percent) were existing electric, according to the direction of services for traffic issues (DSAT). Still, Joe Chan stressed that in recent years, the government has implemented several measures to promote less polluting transportation, including the creation of more loading spaces for electric vehicles. Farther At the end of 2023, Macao had 2,100 electric charging places for light cars and 500 for motorcycles, indicated the direction of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) on its portal. Authorities launched in 2023 a financial support plan for the slaughter of obsolete motorcycles and new electrical motorcycle replacement of a maximum of eight thousand patacas. According to DSAT, in 2024 Macao had 128,542 motorcycles, and only 3.5 percent were electrical, an increase of 1.4 percentage points over the previous year. Joe Chan suggested that authorities start by restricting heavy goods from goods, namely those used in construction, and public transport, "since Zhuhai [the city neighboring Macau] and border zones use natural gas and electricity." On Wednesday, DSAT officials told Radio Macau's Chinese channel that there are 929 new energy buses in operation, representing more than 92 percent of the total, while the proportion of more polluting buses descended to about 3 percent. As for taxis, there are only only electrical in circulation, representing about 11.9 percent of the total number, while the hybrid taxis represent about 86.2 percent of the total. "However, when it comes to highly polluting vehicles, such as trucks and heavy motorcycles, authorities have not yet defined a very clear calendar and deadline for their progressive elimination, so pollution [they cause] is high." , lamented the environmentalist.

item.title: Japan | Government will study Trump's tariffs on steel
item.description: The Japanese government said yesterday that it will study the plans of the president of the United States regarding the imposition of tariffs in the order of 25 percent on steel and aluminum imports. "We are aware of what President Trump said about steel and aluminum, from Japan, we will carefully study the content of the measure he takes and his influence and later we will take the right measures," said the spokesman From the Japanese government, Yoshimasa Hayashi, at a press conference. Hayashi made these comments when asked about President Trump's announcement to impose reciprocal tariffs on other business partners and a 25 percent rate on steel and aluminum imports. "I don't know if the announcement includes Japan, but the agreement between Nippon Steel and U.S. Steel is a great way to resolve the issue and, although not knowing how it will be realized, I think this is how they intend to overcome the problem," he said Masakazu Tokura, president of the largest Japanese employer organization, Keidanren, to NHK public station. Tokura referred to the latest developments in the process of acquiring U.S. Steel by the Japanese Nippon Steel.

item.title: HK | Electronic cigarettes will be prohibited in public places
item.description: Hong Kong will prohibit the possession and use of electronic cigarettes in public spaces by mid -2026 due to the health implications of young residents, authorities of the Chinese Semiautonoma region said. "To protect our young people, we believe it is time to ban the use of electronic cigarettes cartridges," the secretary for health, Lo Chung-Mau, said on Sunday. "We will start by legislating against possession and use [of electronic cigarettes] outdoors," he added. "When everyone gets used to [the prohibition], we will implement it everywhere," he added. The announcement was made almost three years after the territory of southern China prohibited the importation, manufacture and sale of electronic cigarettes and heated tobacco products. According to the Hong Kong law, anyone who imports electronic cigarettes can face up to seven years in prison and a two million dollars of Hong Kong. Manufacturers and sellers risk catching up to six months in prison. Also the neighboring region of Macao banned, in 2022, the manufacture, distribution, importation, export and transportation at the entrance and exit of the territory of electronic cigarettes. The government justified the changes to the law with “the strong evidence that this type of tobacco product is not only harmful to health, but also the use can endanger the safety of people”, noting that the consumption of electronic cigarettes increased, increased, increased, increased, increased, increased cigarettes, especially among young people. Fashion Since 2015, the consumption of electronic cigarettes among young people aged 13 to 15 has increased by “2.6 percent to 4 percent”, according to data revealed in May 2022 by the Director of Health Services of Macao. That is, he stressed Alvis Lo Iek Long, there are already young people to use electronic cigarettes than traditional (2.1 percent). The law provides for penalties to four thousand patacas, and in the case of entities, a fine between 20 thousand patacas and 200 thousand patacas can be applied. Although the proposal was unanimously approved, during the debate in the Legislative Assembly, several deputies maintained that Macau should go further and advance also with the total ban on the use of electronic cigarettes. The then Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, Elsie to Ieong U, confirmed that the government consisted later forbid the use of electronic cigarettes after giving "some time" to smokers who could "have some in stock." Thirty -five countries banned the sale of electronic cigarettes, the World Health Organization said in 2024.

item.title: Chongqing | Annulled restrictions on the purchase and sale of houses
item.description: Chinese Chongqing metropolis, one of the most populous in the country, announced on Sunday the end of the latest restrictions on the purchase of houses, aiming to counteract a prolonged crisis in the real estate sector. In a statement, the city's Municipal Housing and Urban Development Commission announced the abolition of the last remaining exemption, following the elimination of a policy that required the property to be detained for at least two years before it could be sold. According to local press, this means that there are no restrictions on the sale of houses in Chongqing, which has almost 32 million inhabitants, in an area similar to that of Austria, although it includes many rural areas divided into 12 villages. At the end of 2022, the metropolis, located in downtown China, began to make the restrictions imposed in previous years flexible in the face of a overheated market. The city prohibited, for example, families from owning more than one house. The financial situation of many Chinese real estate companies worsened after Beijing was announced in August 2020 restrictions on access to bank financing for promoters who had accumulated a high level of debt, including Evergrande, with a liability of almost 330 billion dollars. In recent months, the local government has announced several support measures, with state banks also opening multimillion credit lines to several promoters, aiming to finance the completion of projects sold in plant, an issue that worries Beijing for the implications for social stability, given that real estate is one of the main investment vehicles of Chinese families. However, the market is not reacting: commercial sales measured by floor area fell 8.5 percent in 2023 and 12.9 percent in 2024.

item.title: Cook Islands | China says that visits the Prime Minister does not aim to third parties
item.description: China yesterday insisted that the visit of the COOK Prime Minister to Beijing this week is not intended to conspire against any country in the South Pacific, although the trip caused a diplomatic dispute with New Zealand. "The relationship between China and the Cook Islands is not for third parties and should not be subject or disturbed by third parties," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun. New Zealand Foreign Minister Winston Peters said he had repeated in a call with Cook Prime Minister Mark Brown, which he should discuss with New Zealand the content of the global strategic partnership and other agreements that Brown intends to sign with in China. "This absence of consultations is a matter of great concern for the government of New Zealand," said Peters's office in a widespread statement on Sunday. The Cook Islands, a set of 15 small islands with a population of 15,000 inhabitants but with a large exclusive economic zone, have been self-government in free association with New Zealand, their largest source of help. The agreement, almost 60, allows the cook islands inhabitants to have citizenship and New Zealand passports and work and live in New Zealand. Brown said New Zealand was informed that the agreement with China does not concern security, but that Wellington has no right to review the exact writing of any documents. The Prime Minister said that his visit of state to Beijing will focus on renewable energy and agriculture, but will also address the development of maritime transport and the exploration of minerals at sea bottom, areas that have particularly concerned with New Zealand, Australia or the United States.

item.title: Diplomacy | Wang Yi goes to the United Kingdom and Germany before a UN meeting
item.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will move to the United Kingdom, Ireland, Germany and South Africa, between February 12 and 21, his ministry announced yesterday. Wang will also attend a United Nations Security Council meeting in New York on 18 February, the same source said in a statement. During his stay in the United Kingdom, Chinese diplomacy chief will participate in the tenth round of the China - United Kingdom dialogue with his British homologist David Lammy. Then he will move to Ireland, where he will meet with the deputy minister and minister of foreign and trade, Simon Harris. In Germany, Wang Yi will participate in the 61st Munich Security Conference, where he will intervene in a forum dedicated to China, to present Beijing's position on international issues. China takes over the rotating presidency of the United Nations Security Council in February. In this context, on the 18th, Wang goes to New York to participate in an open debate of the organ. The Asian country, as a rotary president of the Council, also invited US Diplomacy Chief Marco Rubio for the event, with whom Wang should keep a meeting in a context of commercial friction between the two powers. The minister will also attend the meeting among the heads of diplomacy of the G20 countries, which will take place on February 20 and 21 in Johannesburg, at the invitation of his South African counterpart, Naledi Pandor.

item.title: Weddings | Number in China has fallen to the lowest value since 1980
item.description: China registered 6.1 million marriages in 2024, the lowest number since the records began in 1980, according to data released yesterday by the Ministry of Civil Affairs. The number represents a new decline, after a recovery in 2023, after consecutive years of contraction, according to the statistical report of the fourth quarter of 2024, spread by the ministry. By 2023, 7.68 million marriages were registered in the Asian country, compared to 6.83 million in 2022, a number that was already a historical minimum. Chinese experts explained that the 2023 peak could be due to factors such as Covid-19 pandemic, which led to a reduction in personal interaction between men and women, resulting in a postponement effect of the wedding and after the pandemic period. According to experts, the reasons for the decline in the number of marriage records since 2014 include a reduction in the young population, the gender imbalance in China, with more men than women among the young population, the postponement of the age of marriage , high costs to marry and a change of attitudes towards marriage. At the 20th Congress of the Chinese Communist Party in 2022, the party in power stressed that the country needs a system that “increases birth rates and reduces the costs of pregnancy, childbirth, education and children's education”. . China registered a decline of the population by 2022, 2023 and 2024, the first contractions since 1961.

item.title: Lunar New Year | Increased spending removes deflation
item.description:
The increase in consumption during Chinese New Year festivities relieved the deflationary pressure. The consumer price index rose 0.5% in January
Inflation in China accelerated in January, for the first time since August, due to the strong increase in families' spending, at the time of Lunar New Year's holidays, contrary to persistent deflationist pressures. The Consumer Price Index (IPC) rose 0.5 percent in January, in relation to the same period, said the National Statistics Office (NBS) on Sunday. In December, inflation settled at 0.1 percent. The temporary increase in consumption during the eight -day break briefly checked the size of the world's second largest economy. The price of services increased by 0.9 percent, representing more than 50 percent of the total IPC increase, according to NBS. The deflation in China factories extended for the 28th consecutive month, with a decline of 2.3 percent, remaining stable, compared to the contraction of the index in December. The date of Lunar New Year's holidays - between January 28 and February 4 may have distorted the homologous comparison. This festive period, which follows the lunar calendar, pits in different periods every year. Last year was celebrated in full in February. Focus inside Domestic consumption is increasingly crucial to China, at a time when trade war with the US intensifies. Chinese families' spending could compensate for the effects of increased customs rates imposed by the new US President Donald Trump on assets from the Asian country. The Chinese government has already advanced plans to increase public spending and reduce interest rates. With the wealth of families under pressure due to a prolonged crisis in the real estate sector, increased consumption was elevated to the main priority of this year's economic efforts. The persistence of deflationist pressures in China is strongly contrasts with other major economies. Beijing's fear is that a rooted pricing cycle can restrain families 'expenses for longer and harm the companies' revenues in such a way tohabit the investment and lead to new salary cuts and disqualification.

item.title: WTO | Hong Kong complains against US tariffs
item.description: Hong Kong will file a complaint with the World Trade Organization (WTO) in the face of the imposition of new tariffs by the United States to the products and services of that Chinese semi -autonomous region. "US measures are absolutely inconsistent with the relevant WTO rules and ignore our separate customs status," Hong Kong government spokesman said in a statement. The territory executive "will formally initiate procedures in accordance with the WTO litigation resolution mechanism against US irrational measures to defend our legitimate rights," he added. Last Thursday, Hong Kong's Secretary for Economic Trade and Development, Algernon Yau Ying-Wah, had already said the city was considering resorting to the WTO. Algrenon Yau condemned in a radio program the imposition of an additional 10 percent tariff on imports from the territory, classifying the irrational measure. "It is a disrespect for the region status as a member of the WTO and Autonomous Customs Territory," he said. "Washington made a significant mistake by imposing these tariffs," he warned, installing the White House to "approach the decision with prudence." The secretary said that over the past decade, the United States have registered a commercial surplus of more than $ 270 billion with Hong Kong, underlining the benefits of bilateral trade. In addition, he said that exports from the former British colony to the country represent only 0.1 percent of the total, suggesting a limited impact of new customs rights. Yau noted that in recent years, Hong Kong has diversified its markets, such as Middle East, Southeast Asia and Central Europe, to mitigate “the repercussions of geopolitics”, allowing local companies to adjust export strategies.

item.title: Hamas | Five released Thai hostages return home
item.description: Five Thai hosts released by Hamas arrived in Bangkok yesterday, 16 months after they were kidnapped by the Palestinian Islamite group in Israel, international agencies reported. Agricultural workers were released on January 30, under the first phase of the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, an agreement that aims to end the war triggered on October 7, 2023 by the Hamas attack on the soil Israelite. Watchara Sriaoun, Pongsak Tanna, Sathan Suwannakham, Surasak Lamnau and Bannawat Saethao landed at Suvarnabhumi Airport from Bangkok at 07:30, according to France-Presse news agency. The group was received by family members and Thai Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa, wrote the EFE news agency. Speaking to the press, Sangiampongsa said the five are in good physical condition, although they continue to be evaluated. "Mental health is the next important issue," said the official, leaving thanks to the countries that contributed to the ceasefire in Gaza. Sombon Saethao, the father of Bannawat Saethao, said he was “very happy” for being able to meet his son, who will dedicate a traditional Thai ceremony. "I don't think I want him to be away from home," he added. On October 7, 2023, Hamas kidnapped 31 Thai, 23 of which were released before the end of this year and two declared dead in May 2024. It is believed that one last hostage of Thailand, detained in Gaza, is still alive.

item.title: Ricardo Clara Couto, author of the documentary about Francisco de Pina | The weight of the guilt that persists
item.description: “Francisco de Pina - The Portuguese who wrote the future of Vietname” tells the story of Father Jesuit, born in Guarda in 1586, who made the romanization of the Vietnamese alphabet. The documentary, by Ricardo Clara Couto was funded by RTP2 and aired at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center How did you come across this character in Portuguese history in the East? My brother, named Filipe Pires, traveled for Vietnam for a while and when he arrived from the trip he told me that he had to know the incredible history of the Jesuit Francis of Pina who had made the romanization of the Vietnamese alphabet, providing freedom and cultural independence tremendous. I was a little skeptical at first, because I found it strange no one to know this in Portugal, but I started my research on the subject and discovered a university study of a Franco-Vietnamese teacher who teaches in Madeira. I then confirmed that the idea that my brother had brought from Vietname was correct. From there, I tried to discover the origin of this priest, the work he had done, and realize why there was so little knowledge about Francisco de Pina in Portugal. In addition to being a Jesuit missionary, can you highlight some biographical points that help you understand your legacy? In the documentary I did not have the time to be able to take a more exhaustive biographical approach. I focused on the part where he arrives at Vietname. We talk about a man with an incredible culture and a desire to acculturate and be acculturated. A man who was a musician and was easier, thus learning the Vietnamese, which is a six -tone language. Deep down, despite being a Jesuit priest, he had the first of course culture and not so much religion. This, for me, is a reason for huge admiration. For him the essential objective of evangelization was secondary, because, for him, if we could not understand the culture of Vietname, we could not teach the Vietnamese people. It was more important to deepen local culture and language, making it possible to be able to explore the most religious part. It was also a man who had a hard time when he arrived at Vietname. Why? There were some internal wars before some local gentlemen of the regions who did not agree with the mission of the priests. This is not explored in the documentary, but in fact Francisco de Pina even made some steps [for the Jesuit mission], as the priests were not totally accepted everywhere. He eventually took refuge in a Japanese neighborhood and, from there, built his base. Francisco de Pina, like what happened to many Jesuits at the time, was training in Macau, at the College of S. Paulo. How was it influenced by this period spent in the territory? There is not much information about this time. It is known that it was indeed formed in this college, as was the case with many Jesuit priests at the time, but then went to Japan. Only then go to Vietname. So far, there was nothing of great relief in the life of Francisco de Pina, who followed the normal way. Japan was already expelling the Jesuit priests and it is in this context that goes to Vietname. The only most prominent thing about this period is that the 14 ships that left Portugal to arrive in Macau this year remained only three, and the ship where I was Pina Francisco was one of those who survived the storm. Do you consider that your great legacy was the romanization of Vietnamese? What are the great contributions of this process in linguistic terms? It is a giant contribution. If we think that even in the romanization of the language, Vietname was very dependent on the Chinese alphabet, and could not have cultural, linguistic and economic independence as well. After the romanization of the alphabet it was possible for Vietname to grow in these domains and have her own identity. The country has grown a lot to this day, because without writing a tongue passes only to the new generations of mouth in mouth, and the legacy of Francisco de Pina also remains today. The Vietnamese people are very grateful to this, and the proof is that two years ago a delegation of the Vietnammemesse Language Foundation Foundation came to Portugal and offered a monument to Guarda City Council (see Caixa) in honor of Francisco de Pina. However, I was surprised by the fact that the Vietnamese, and we talked about full -sided academics, know the story, the figure of Francisco de Pina, existing in the country several references. But in Portugal it is a little known figure. How do you explain this? I think this will have to do with the need Portugal has to make its catharsis about this period of history. Portugal was a completely different country from Africa to the East, and completely different from Africa to the Americas. But, however, there is this weight of guilt. Portugal cannot talk about this period of time, despite having a rich history between Africa and the East, but this time is not very approached because the country has not taken over what happened and, therefore, cannot talk about this period. Therefore, so much of the rich history of Portugal is unknown to the Portuguese. How was the research process for the documentary? I quickly arrived at the study of Professor Minh Ha Nguyen Lo Cicero of the University of Madeira, and with her we went to the roots of the Vietnamese language. When I discovered it was amazing, because it is part of the Vietnamese alphabet romanization triangle, as it is Franco-Vietnamese. Until recently, the official version that existed was that Alexandre de Rhodes, French Jesuit, had romanized the alphabet, later registering it in the Vatican and saying that it was a work in honor of his master, Francisco de Pina. However, the name of Francisco de Pina disappeared. From here we passed to the nationalist French official narrative that the romanization of the alphabet had been made by French because Vietname was a French colony. Then I also arrived at Professor António Morgado. The remaining contacts were made at Vietname, linguists, university professors and language specialists, especially in writing, who later joined the documentary. How would you describe the Vietname of the time of Francisco de Pina? It was very fragmented. They have a very their own culture that existed through a writing with Chinese hieroglyphics, but deals with Vietnamese, which led only 1 to 3 percent of the population to read and write. With the romanization this percentage increased exponentially, and with this the culture developed with the populations, united them more around common writing. I think this has made Vietname more modern and prepared to integrate into the rest of the world by having a more affordable language. Do you feel it will help unravel this part of the history of Portugal, as well as the history of the Jesuit mission itself? I hope so. Portugal seems to have a certain fear and shame to talk about this time, and proof of this is that this Vietnamese people came to Guard to offer a monument and practically did not come out of the subject. In addition, the representatives of the Vietname delegation were a little admired for not being received at an official level, except for the mayor of Guarda. I, who was invited by them to be present, felt a little shame of others, because Vietname came to Portugal to offer a monument and this is viewed as a secondary event, which is not. It would be important to make known this priest and this made to the country and the world, because Portugal and Vietnam have a very close and rich cultural history, as with Japan and China. But this is a little known aspect of the Portuguese people and [this documentary] can be a good opportunity for the country to make their catharsis. Vietnamese artist sculpture resembles Francisco de Pina at Guarda In November 2023, the Vietnamese Language Foundation offered the city of Guarda the sculpture “Nova Estela” by Vietnamese artist Nguyen Huy Anh. item.title: Francisco Leandro, author and professor at the University of Macao: “Support from the country reinforces the role of Macao platform”
item.description:
Gang Wen interview with China Daily newspaper Francisco Leandro, an associate professor at the Faculty of Social Sciences at the University of Macao, states that the nation's support has allowed the MSA to serve as the Center for Commerce, Investment and Cultural Interactions between China and Portuguese Language Communities.
How do you see Macau's development since your return to the homeland? Among the city's achievements, which ones impressed him most? What about its sector, has there been an important progress in the last 25 years? The 25th anniversary of Macau's return to the homeland and the creation of the Special Administrative Region of Macao is a significant milestone in the history of the region, reflecting a successful diplomatic process and demonstrating its current political and economic stability. Currently, RAE de Macao enjoys political stability and is deeply integrated into national development plans. The governance of the city under the beginning of “a country, two systems” allowed him to maintain a high degree of autonomy, while aligning himself with national policies. This integration facilitated Macao's economic growth, making it a vital part of the country's broader economic strategy. Macao's socioeconomic development strategy is consecrated in the policy “a center, a platform, a base”. This picture aims to position MSA as a world center of tourism and leisure, reinforcing its attraction as a global tourist destination. In addition, MSAR acts as a platform for economic and commercial cooperation between China and Portuguese -speaking countries, promoting international trade and cultural exchange. Rae de Macao is also becoming a base of exchange and cultural cooperation, promoting cultural interactions and the conservation of heritage. This multifaceted approach supports Macao's integration into national development plans and reinforces its global presence. The unique position of MSA as a bridge between China, in particular the large Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay, and Portuguese-speaking countries underline their strategic importance. The concept of “a platform, three centers” enhances Macao's role in promoting economic and cultural exchange. This platform allowed the city to serve as a platform for trade, investment and cultural interactions, reinforcing the ties between China and the Lusophone world. Macau's development as a tourism and leisure center, along with the promotion of four main industries - conventions and exhibitions, cultural and creative industries, traditional Chinese medicine and modern financial services - diversified its economy. These initiatives not only boosted economic activity, but also reinforced the global attraction of Macau as a tourist destination. The central government adopted a series of policies for Macao. Is there any specific measure that has benefited your sector? As? The interior of China and the Macao Economic Economic Partnership Agreement (Cepa) play a crucial role in the great bay and in the promotion of ties with Portuguese -speaking countries. By promoting commercial and economic cooperation, the strain reinforces the position of MSA as a bridge between China and Lusophone countries. This agreement facilitates access to the market, investment and cultural exchange, promoting Macao as an international business center. In addition, the strain supports the integration of Macau in the Great Bay area, contributing to regional development and economic diversification. This strategic role underlines the importance of Macau in the broader economic and diplomatic initiatives in the country. The promotion of higher education in RAE de Macao also played a crucial role in its development. In investing in education and research, Macau contributed to the objectives of national development and was positioned as a center of academic excellence. This bet on education has allowed to create a skilled labor, essential to sustain economic growth and innovation. The University of Macao is highly considered in global academic rankings. It was classified in 180th place at the World University Rankings 2025 by Times Higher Education, and 245th at QS World University Rankings 2025. In addition, the University of Macao is ranked 262nd in the best global universities by US News & World Report. These classifications reflect the university's commitment to excellence in teaching and research, particularly in areas such as Artificial Intelligence, Engineering and Social Sciences. The university's strong international collaboration and innovative investigation contribute significantly to their estimated global position. This year is the third anniversary of the creation of the Guangdong-Macau in-depth cooperation zone in Hengqin. In your opinion, how should Macau continue to take advantage of the advantages of the zone to develop himself and the education sector? Hengqin's cooperation zone is one of the main objectives of Macao's modernization efforts. This zone has been fundamental to boosting innovation and economic diversification, providing a space for new industries and promoting a narrower integration with the continent. The area exemplifies Macau's commitment to modernization and its strategic role in regional development. Macao is a unique mix of Chinese and Portuguese cultures. In your opinion, how can this merger help the nation to reinforce communication with the international community and tell the good stories of China? Macao is a fascinating mix of cultures, where the East meets the West in a unique and harmonious way. His linguistic landscape is a testimony of his multicultural heritage. The Chinese is the official language and the Portuguese language can be used for official purposes, reflecting the historical ties of Macao with Portugal and its Chinese roots. English is also widely spoken, especially in business and tourism, which makes Macau a truly multilingual society. The legal system of MSAR is another domain in which this cultural mixture is evident. Based on the Portuguese Civil Law System, it was adapted to the local context under the “one country, two systems” principle. This double legal system allows a unique mix of Chinese and Western legal traditions, ensuring that Macau's legal environment is familiar to its residents and accessible to international companies. Macao's approach to the extrajudicial resolution of commercial conflicts further enhances its multicultural policy. The city offers various arbitration and mediation services that serve both local and international parts, promoting the efficient and friendly resolution of disputes. Macao's open city policy and multicultural attitude are the key to its success as a global center. The city welcomes people from around the world, promoting a diverse and inclusive community. This opening is reflected in its festivals, its gastronomy and their daily lives, where different cultures coexist and enrich each other. Essentially, the mix of language, legal systems and multicultural attitudes of Macau makes it a unique and dynamic place that establishes bridges between cultures and promotes global bonds. What achievements would you like to see by Macau in the next 25 years? In short, Macao's future is brilliant, with greater integration with mainland China, its central role in international trade, diversified economic growth and a strong global presence. These elements will ensure Macao's continuous success and development at the world scene. The 25th anniversary of Macao's return to the Fatherland celebrates not only a successful diplomatic achievement, but also the continuous contributions of the region to national and world development. Macao's strategic initiatives and their integration in national plans underline their importance as a dynamic region and facing the future.

item.title: António Antunes, cartoonist: “Sometimes I consider myself an artist”

What was it like to deal with all this controversy? This cartoon [Pope John Paul II] was controversial because they wanted to be so. That went very well and did not generate any ranks. In the face of what led me to do this cartoon, I did it again. The Pope's statements at the time were public, they were not even hidden, inside walls, and spoke to the whole world, so also to me. The first one that sensitized me was the one who made me win the world's largest salon in the world [major prize of the XX Salon International of Cartoon, Montreal, 1983], from this corner that is Portugal. A hall that had over a thousand participants, and gaining it was very good. I was safer, confident, because from then on they could continue to do things. This first cartoon also gave controversy, the “Warsaw Ghetto in Shatila”, in which I use the known photograph of the ghetto, a Jewish kid raised, harassed by Nazi soldiers, and in the cartoon the kid is Palestinian and Israeli soldiers. [The controversy was] with all the voices of the Jews, who are experts in this, making a lot of noise, with a certain tone of victimization, even if they are attacking. A hall director said he tried to change the vote, such is the weight of Jewish lobby, but failed. This cartoon could be drawn today again. I already published it again. Unfortunately it is not out of date. But do you feel that much of what you designed about today is repeated, in a sign that the story is cyclical? There is a resistance to change. One of the merits of the cartoonist is to be able to see ahead of time, or over time if you want. I have the invasion of Crimea made in 2014, and I assume that vision. It was above, and others did it later. There are other examples. It begins to do cartoon after April 25, 1974, there a little there in the aftermath of the revolution. Do you feel that, in a way, has inaugurated the discipline of the Political Cartoon in Portugal? Perhaps. But I'm not very clear about it, because before me there was a great designer, João Abel Manta, a fantastic chart, which had a huge difference from us, because we were kids and he already had a culture that allowed him that. But there is a less good side, because he did political propaganda. He was a man of the Portuguese Communist Party (PCP), and made this advertisement to where the revolution allowed it. Then when things stabilized, he went out and went to do other things. This does not remove the quality, but it is not my notion of Cartoon. I respond to the various stimuli of events otherwise. Cartoon allows me to express opinions, but be able to do so in different meanings of life, perspectives, without being a prisoner, as he became a prisoner of the PCP, was something that helped me a lot. Did you ever feel any pressure from the newspapers where you collaborated? (Hesitates). Some things, but they are not important. One thing I got, without much effort, was to make people think I have a bad shape, and it was better not to get me. It helped because they thought twice before talking to me. But this [the image of bad shape] really helped me. And there is also the story of me having another profession. He was a friend of the commercial director, a comfortable type, who was staring to negotiate contracts with the newspaper in the name of A Tabaqueira. Therefore, I conveyed an effective image of power that actually did not have. If you add a type that has bad shape to a type that apparently has power, it is a boring (laughs). When I ask you about the pressures, I think in the period right after April 25, 1974-1975, when everything was politicized. Were there bigger? I managed to deal with it. They are politicians with a very clear speech about what they want and what they want, and this can be good for Cartoon. How do you feel to go to Macau again? I'm full of curiosity, promoting the show, seeing what they ask me, but this is part of the game. The press of Macao does not have a great presence of Cartoon, except for Rodrigo [Rodrigo de Matos]. I am shy, but I've been treating myself. (laughs) It was never something that had blocked me, I speak well in public. I'm a type I don't like to take stupid risks. I have been in this building for several years and I know only the gate because it has to be, and I do not want to have the risk of having an antipatic person to whom I confident.
